review: I appreciated the manager reaching out to me and trying to make things better. I understand that no place is gonna be perfect. But the reason why I bumped up my rating to a four stars without even stepping foot into the doors yet is the fact that the manager had the patience to listen to my frustrations and tried to make things better. No excuses were given, just a simple apology for my experience. I left our conversation feeling valued and appreciated.  I will give this location another try!

Am getting really frustrated with what was favorite place....  I wrote a review and post a picture of a waiter who was putting his hands down his pants in the front and back, tucking in his shirt 11 days ago, and then went onto serving food without even washing his hands first. Days later a "Mickey" contacted me and in a professional manner apologized followed by an offer to come back. He also asked that I email him to provide a chance to send me a few coupons to use for another visit that would allow his team to redeem themselves.  I replied and after a week, there has yet to be a response from the manager who claimed improved and impressive service......  So much for the weekly trips to take the Family out to that Chilis; even though the food there is awesome, having a guy touching where the sun don't shine and then my food is unsat.

I am a stickler for customer service, as I feel, this is the factor that often makes a food establishment stand out for me. That being said, I love the variety of food available at chili's...it's a nice place to eat when you want something pretty low-key, but tasty.  I ordered the 6oz sirloin steak and broccoli (no starch). The server was very attentive, making sure our fountain drinks were constantly filled, sometimes anticipating our needs before we were aware of our own needs - this is often a sign of an experienced server.  I ordered my steak medium done, but when I cut into it, it was medium well. I brought this to the attention of our server, who was very apologetic and immediately offered to have the steak redone. As I waited for my meal, the manager, Mickey, came over to the table to apologize and offered a bowl of soup while I waited. In the time it took to have my steak redone, both the server and the manager checked on our table and apologized profusely for the error.  Although chili's is a relatively low-key, family restaurant, they treated us as though they valued our service. I've consistently had relatively good service at chili's, with this experience being the most memorable.

My family and I visited this location on a Sunday morning. It wasn't crowded at all which made watching the football playoffs very comfortable. I wanted to acknowledge our server Jordan for his exceptional service.  I wish I got this kind of service wherever I dined. He was prompt and efficient and made sure we had what we wanted and that everything met our standards. I ask for a lot of side condiments and at times I feel like an inconvenience asking for things. This was not the case at all today, Jordan was so willing to help. I'd definitely come back just to be served by Jordan. My family enjoyed our food and always having a full cup of soft drinks. Don't forget to check inn yelp for your queso and chips.

I received a message asking for a call back concerning the review I wrote about the appetizers.  Five stars for customer care!  An area manager who monitors and expresses his disappointment that the food did not meet and exceed the expectations of the customer is indeed an asset to any company.  After discussing options for the food and suggestions to make another visit be what I expect it to be I will grab my bar buddies and try again.....maybe Jessica the bartender will be there again with the magical margaritas!

"Mexy" was a terrific server! Hooked us up with bottomless chips and salsa and you get a free queso and chips with a check in at ANY Chili's location!  Ordered the triple play sampler but was there for drinks! Blue Moons, Stella's, and Margaritas were the drink of choice tonight.  Not too crowded on the last day for Teachers before Xmas break!

This is my first visit to this Chili's. I actually haven't eaten at Chili's for quite awhile. We were shopping out at the outlet stores and decided to stop in for an early dinner. We were seated at the bar area for some reason. It was a bit loud with several TVs playing and multiple people at the bar. Our server, Jessica, was a very prompt and sweet. We ordered some ice tea for drinks, followed by the shrimp and steak fajitas for dinner. My daughter really enjoyed the fajitas. For dessert we had the chocolate molten lava cake. The cake was very chocolatey and moist, definitely a good choice for dessert. Other than the restaurant being a bit too loud, it was a good experience.

Wasn't my choice to come here, but if I had a choice this wouldn't be an option... located in the lower half of Waikele Premium Outlets where the McD's is... Layout of the place is similar to others locations and have the same menu as other locations... my kids for some reason love to come here... My opinion of the food here is like going to the frozen section of a grocery store, heating up the food, plating and then serving! My kids said they liked what they had and couldn't finish all and made a doggie bag for the rest to take home. As for my plate of their version of the Rib Eye with steamed broccoli and mashed potatoes... the meat was a little tougher than it looked and the seasoning was very heavy and salty! Even the broccoli was so salty that I couldn't eat all of them... the only item that was decent was the mash potatoes and that's pretty sad for a Rib Eye dish! That or I'm too spoiled with tender meat that doesn't feel like rubber in my mouth as I chew :/ Service was okay... my kids were giving him a hard time so I can understand he didn't wanna come around as often... we didn't run out of water but he did take his take to clear our tab because the tablet on our table wasn't working...  Chilis would be the perfect place for a gathering if the food tasted more like how it was priced! We could've gotten fresher and better tasting dishes from someplace cheaper! You won't find me here at my own will but if you do, I'm taking one for the team! Grind On! Pau!

Excellent service from Jordan once again! He's always very attentive to all his guests! He is also very accommodating and makes excellent recommendations ! The food is always good, but when you have a server like him, it makes your experience all the better!

The location of this Chili's is great because there are many good shopping places nearby.  There are also a few food trucks to choose from when you get hungry and crave a small snack. We had to wait about 5-10 minutes before we were seated.  Our server was extremely friendly and positive from the get-go.  I used the free Yelp coupon (if you "check-in" on Yelp) to get a free chips and queso.  I always love Chili's chips because they are so thin and crispy.  Unfortunately, some of the chips were really oily so they ended up being stale.  They always give more chips, so it was easy to get a refill and forget about the sad, wet chips.  The queso was delicious and unhealthy as usual.  I've never really liked their salsa though... I ordered the chicken enchiladas.  It came with three chicken enchiladas, Mexican rice, and beans.  My dad ordered beef quesadillas while my mom got the prime rib tacos.  All of it was delicious, and I only ate ONE chicken enchilada because I was so full!  That must be a record for me (I eat a lot).  My mom insisted that I try one of her prime rib tacos, and I will admit, it was delish.  However, the juices that the prime rib was in was a little too salty for my liking. Other than a few of the chips and the salty prime rib juices, the meal and experience was great!  I left satisfied and VERY full.
I LOVE LOVE LOVE CHILI'S! Food is always good, service here is always good and I come here during weekdays to avoid the crowds of weekend shoppers.
Mexy, our server was great! Very prompt with everything! It's especially hard dining with a little one but she brought my daughters food first so she could get eating. Thank you mexy!

Today is a bad day ... freezing cold A/C ... out of salsa ... out of shrimp ... service slow ... need some freebies to make up for it.   Update - woke up in the middle of the night with cold sweats and a very upset stomach.

Super service today from Elena. I tried the buffalo bleu crispers. Not bad because I love bleu cheese. It's light on the buffalo sauce. Only bad part was the piece of tie strap i found in the batter of the crisper. First time I've ever had an issues with anything like this at Chili's.

Seriously, next time you stop in to chilis; waikele, ASK FOR MEXI (MEXY).  she said "there's no preference to the spelling, they'll know who youre talking about." Lol. She has impeccable service and will hoooook iiiiit up.  Enjoy! And we will all see YOUR review soon enough!!

There is never anyone to greet you at check in booth unlike most other places I go to. This is the second Chilis location I visited in a week.  This location seemed bigger. And clean. And  not sure why. Again we are seated in the bar. Second visit in a row. I fell in love with the loaded baked potato soup so I came back for that. Yum. That was good. We had the chips with salsa and guacamole and that was great! My bf had the salad with bowl of chili. Salad went well, but the bowl of chili? Either it was spoiled or they use some funky ingredient in the chili. It tasted pretty darn gnarly. Truthfully, like my dogs shampoo!  and best part of all, not once did the waitress come by to ask if everything was ok other than refill our drinks!! I'm not sure if I can try another chili's!
mexie is awesome! very attentive. knowledgeable. very good customer service! definitely coming back here for the service!
Had a great dinner with the ohana tonight!  Mahalo Mexi for the great service and taking care of our ohana.  Merry Christmas and mahalo!

Went there for our first Thursday of the year Women's Ohana group fellowship.  Our server "Anthony" took very good care of us, we appreciated his service being that we were a party of 7 women.  3 of the sisters ordered the Triple dipper appetizer, 2 ordered the 2 courses for just $17.99, and I ordered the Caribbean salad with shrimp. It was nice that we were given complimentary chips and salsa, as a few of us were already hungry.  I did't realize till after I had already eaten my salad that there were no dried cranberries on it.  I brought that to Anthony's attention and he was apologetic about it.  Oh well, my fault for not telling him when I first got the salad.  The last sister that arrived ordered a salad and the chicken avocado flat bread which I tried to find on the menu and could find it?  Will need to find out if Chili's has a happy hour special on the appetizers, like maybe half off during a certain time frame.  It was quite busy this night, but we all enjoyed ourselves.

Staff here is awesome! A family of 22 of us (Dad, Mother, Step Mother, 6 children, 8 grand children, 2 spouses, 2 nephews & 1 niece) & our waiters Amber, Anthony & Ambers sister Sam is doing an awesome job dealing with us. & did I also mention we kind of came in late from the Waikele lights so we got seated a little close to closing which we passed closing hours. I feel kind of bad but they are handling it really good. Thank you staff team for an awesome customer service with great personality & the best team work EVER! Merry Christmas & Happy New Year.

My boyfriend loves Chilis.  I love shopping at Waikele.   He loves their burgers.  I love their salads.  He gets a beer.  I get a cocktail.  Service is good, wait is never that long if needed, and the food never disappoints -  filling, but not to the point where you feel disgusting after.  What can I say, what more could I ask for?  Highly recommended for those who wanna rest their tired feet from intense outlet shopping in a cool place with a nice alcoholic beverage.

The new chicken and waffles are FIRE! So good! Sweet, spicy, and totally unexpected from Chili's. Don't forget to use the check-in offer! Shoutout to Josiah our server, who was super chill and helpful.

My family and I went there just a few minutes ago, and we were still deciding if we wanted to eat there or not, when a lady at the front desk was asking us what table we wanted and how many we were. We kindly told her that we were still deciding and we needed a few more minutes and not long after, she came back and asked us one more time and we did the same thing and told her to give us a couple more minutes. She then slammed the menus on the desk and gave us a stink eye. It was a large lady with red hair and eyeglasses. This kind of attitude is unacceptable, be patient next time. You just lost four customers.

We came here straight from the airport and by this time there were limited options for open places to eat. We must have walked in about 20 minutes til closing  (which I hate doing but we were hungry and had kids in tow). We were seated quickly in a booth near the bar. Everyone, and I mean everyone (from the hostess, to the woman behind the bar, and everyone who was still working at that time) was so friendly! Our waitress, Felicia, was awesome. She was sweet, very efficient and we never felt rushed. Our food came out fast and was delicious. Great staff. Good food.

Last night, I had a late dinner here with my friend. It was relatively busy being it a Friday night. We're seated quickly with no wait. As we were seated, Angelica greeted us right away, and quickly taken our beverage order. We had eventually ordered table side guac and a triple dipper. Our order came out quick and Angelica made our table side guac to perfection. She was very kind and had made our trip to Chili's comfortably enjoyable. If you go to Waikele Chili's and are waited on by Angelica, you will be well taken care of!
First chilis ive ever been to and can't stop coming back! The waiters are awesome and  ribs are amazing! My favorite is the volcano or molten lane cake

After a round of golf out at the hot and sunny Ewa Plains, our foursome planned to head back East to enjoy a lunch together and commiserate, er, rehash the highs and lows of our round.  Unfortunately, because there had been a six car accident on the H-1 East we all got caught in gridlock.  We quickly texted each other and decided to exit off to the Waipio neighborhood to dine at Chili's. This site has a lot of parking and can accommodate the crowds from the nearby Premium Outlet Mall as well as several other smaller establishments.  There was a waitlist of 20 minutes which seemed reasonable since we noticed all of the tables in the dining room were full.  The hostess offered to seat us in the empty bar area where we could watch television, grab ourselves some cold beverages and probably be waited on right away.   While we waited for a server, the hostess began seating more people in the bar area along with us.   A friendly server came, introduced herself as the bartender and took our beverage order.  She returned quickly with our order and asked if we were ready to order.  We weren't quite ready, so understandably, she went onto the other tables.  It wasn't until after she had taken food orders for the other tables, most of which were large parties, that she returned to check on us and to take our order. The food was decent and eventually another worker came to assist the bartender by refilling our beverages and delivering our dishes.   We all had ordered their "Big Mouth Burgers" with fries.  Each of our burgers was nicely presented, flavorful and done to our liking. Sorry to say but we felt sorry for the poor gal as she was getting overwhelmed.  I know that she had no control over the amount of people coming in to dine but, the shift leader should have at least seen to getting more help into the bar area.  Service was pleasant but very slow. #497
I love coming to this Chili's, always greeted by friendly staff and have our regular outstanding waitress Mexi. Food is great atmosphere is nice. I always go back for more.
The appetizers are good, I also like to get the chicken & steak fajitas on a sizzling platter. Friendly staff and love the game apps on the table.

I love coming to this location because our favorite server Mexi is amazing!!!! She is always such a hard worker and even when she's off of her shift she gets us started with drinks and has a fun conversation with us!   She's so personable and a delight to see every time we go to Chili's.  She makes our weekend even better than before we walked in the door and I couldn't think of a better location to come watch the games and enjoy the food and my wife's company.
Great to watch for the football season. Food were awesome. Server were attentive Parking no problem.

A friend and I came in to get some dessert and we ordered this cobbler type of dish that came in a skillet. In the photo in the menu, it looked as if the cobbler filled the entire skillet and was cooked/baked in it. (Please look for it and tell me it does not look like that lol.) To our great disappointment, a hot skillet did come but a pre-made slice of blueberry cobbler cake sat in the middle of it. You know damn well they did not cook what is clearly a slice of cake in that skillet lol. What was the point of the hot skillet at all though, is my question. For show? So we could pretend that it was what was in the photo? They could've just put the slice of cake on a plate lol. It was the saddest thing. We got nothing else after our cake slice in a hot skillet (we were going to drink but opted not to give them anymore of our money, despite sitting at the bar already) and we left practically not wanting to pay for it because if it wasn't even cooked at the restaurant, why come to a restaurant at all? Never getting "hot" desserts from Chili's again...

Kiosk review: Solely based on kiosk card payments.  MAKE YOUR OWN CALCULATIONS.  It automatically adjusts the suggested tip to 20%. However "their" calculated 20% is marked up to approximately 25%.  That's a lot of money taken from tourists & locals that frequent this location who don't know any better. I definitely support tipping our servers and will overtip for their service most times. It's not right to be fooled into over tipping.  UPDATE: The business manager Mickey had reached out to me to explain how their kiosks work. Basically if you have a coupon (which I didn't have). The kiosk will calculate your tip based on the entire total bill BEFORE the discounted prices to ensure that the servers are being tipped for the food they serve. Ok...I get that. So if they void an item on your receipt because of a mistake with the order taken your tip will still be automatically calculated as if you had ordered that item. In other words, just calculate your own tip rather than paying what they recommend. I can guarantee that everyone at the establishment knows how the kiosk system is set up. Not accusing anyone that they make voids on purpose. But! It's a slick move to keep voiding items to increase the tip amount assuming the customer doesn't check and just hits ok to the automatically suggested/adjusted "20%" amount.  After looking at my receipt, there were voids. Because the server took my order wrong and had to ring the correct order up again. It adjusted to calculate my tip on the entire bill before the voids. Which is why my tip calculated higher.  No change in stars because from what I'm told the kiosk system is out of their control at the store level. However, the manager was kind enough to explain the reasons behind it.

Just got here and the first thing I ordered was the chips and queso. I know they also have a loaded white queso, but I like the simple skillet queso! If you haven't tried it you should! As for the service, they are on top of their game! Our server's name is Mexi. If you ever stop by at this chili's ask to sit in her section. She'll take really great care of you!

Disappointed with my visit today.  I ordered the guacamole as an appetizer an it too brown for me. I sent it back and the manager took it off my bill, but the guacamole was the main reason I came for.

The wait was 15-20 minutes. So my friend  and I waited but it only took us 10 minutes and we were finally seated.  I got free chips and queso for checking in. How cool is that? :) Everything was good from drinks and the food. I have no problem with that, except the service. It's been 20minutes and they still haven't taken our order. Drinks took a while to be served. Poor customer service.  The watermelon lemonade was good. The chips and salsa and the queso is the bomb! I can eat a whole lot. The mango tilapia was good too just a little bit spicy.  The watermelon cooler was great!  Will i recommend? Yes if you dont mind the wait to be served. And what is the proper wait time to be served when you're seated at the table? 5? 10? 15? 20 minutes?   3 STARS!
Mexi was great! On top of filling our drinks without having to ask.  Service was excellent.

the first time i came here i didnt like it because of what i had which was the grilled fish. until my bf introduced me to their TRIPLE DIPPER! YUM!!!!!! i literally get that everytime i come here now haha i get the big mouth poppers, fried pickles (my fave) & the cheddar bites. but today, we tried their california grilled chicken flatbread pizza & omg! that was the best pizza i have ever tasted in my life! the flavor was so good! all the sauces they used was so flavorful & all the toppings just matched together. i am def ordering that again!
It's decent I went once and it's enough. Food was okay, service  need more attention in that area. However, it's good overall.

Huge improvement! Our service was amazing and starting it off with our server named Angelica who was very professional and very fast. She had what look like multiple tables, and was able handle it with ease. She made it look so easy.  may have been under staffed but Angelica looked like she could run her area.

Not bad. Fun atmosphere. I love the individual tv monitors for kids to use. For a while this was the only place my husband and I could bring our son with autism. It still pretty much is the only place we can bring him without me getting filled with anxiety. I can't give them 5 because I always feel that their food is over salted, and because we have had some really bad servers.

I have been to many Chilis as I am from Texas... where Chilis originated. But let me tell you! I had the the most attentive server! We order the chicken strips and used the  yelp check in for free chips and queso!! Our server was the best! I ordered margarita( probably came out within a couple of minutes of ordering it)... she was constantly refilling and asking if we were good! All the other tables were talking story to her also! I will definitely be coming to this Chilis location specifically because of the server! ASK TO BE IN MEXI SECTION!
Love this place.  Good people and service.  Mark pulls all the girls... Good family place
Very poor service. Food took 40 minutes plus; water refilled one over the course of 90 minutes. Staff looked disinterested or could care less.

I'd like to make a special shoutout to our server, Amber. She gave the best customer service that I just have to give her 5 stars. She was really kind and funny too! I liked that she was attentive and gave recommendations. She even suggested to try the skillet chocolate chip cookie. Sooo good!!   She also gave us chips to take home that night.  Thank you, Amber!

I hadn't been to this Chili's in awhile but we went recently for a business lunch.  They renovated since I had last ate here and the restaurant looked more open and spacious.  It wasn't busy so we were seated right away.  We were greeted and attended to by our waiter really quick.  Appetizers ordered!  He told us to check in on Yelp to get our appetizer for free - thanks for the tip!  Nothing like a free Skillet Queso.  We ordered our beverages and didn't have to wait long at all.  Lunch specials came quickly, food was tasty and fresh, and it was a really nice lunch.  Our water was friendly and attentive throughout.
The food poisoning I got from this restaurant location last night was epic. Beware of the chicken here, it doesn't taste so good coming back up.

This place is loved by most people back home and since Genki was crazy busy, we settled to dine in here. I honestly thought the food wasn't great but I give this place FIVE stars because of the exceptional customer service our server delivered. I can't quite remember his name just yet but he was accommodating and patient with our BIG party of 15. He was attentive, funny, quick, and communicated very well with when our orders will be out. The best part of this dining experience was when they came out to sing "Happy Birthday" to me...LOL!

This is a great Chili's to visit if your out shopping at Lowes or the outlet stores in Waikele  The service is good and be sure to check in on Yelp for their offer of chips and Queso.  They have a new Spring menu to try as well as all the standards. I like their pick three Appitizer to share at the table.  Plenty of parking and just across the street from the Outlets.

The service was amazing and the surprise coupon from Yelp, for the bean dip, was awesome. The restaurant was not as busy, as I thought it would be, on a Sunday which was great. I got the "nachos". They were horrible!!! They were made with pita chips. I had about 8-10 chips. When it came put there were greasy, no crunch at all, and very very bendable. They also tasted stale. However, my families food was amazingly good. I would definitely go back, just won't order nachos!!!

I haven't really been to chili's much but since the kiddos love eating here, this was the restaurant of choice. Since the Mililani restaurant is usually packed,  I headed to the Waikele location for dinner. I didn't know this but you can call ahead to make a reservation. Luckily, the wait was only 15 minutes for a table.  Once seated we were greeted by our server, whom became MIA when it was time to order. I must say, I was impressed with their menu as they added healthier menu options like quinoa, asparagus and expanded their lighter menu choices. I do love their drink menu.. coronita time for me! We decided on a flat bread pizza and fajitas. The flat bread pizza was delicious! However the fajitas were a fail. Very few pieces of meat and the veggies weren't cooked thoroughly.  I always love my dinner company more than the food here. Since the kiddos love eating here, chili's will still be one of the dinner options for us. If eating without the kiddos, I'd pass on dinner here and just have drinks.

Chili's is a hit or miss in this area.  The last time we were there last week, it was a total hit because of our server in the bar area.  She was great.  She knew what she was doing and was great at checking in every so often as well.   I particularly like the fact that you know what you're getting pretty much all the time.  I got the chicken sandwich with fries and ice tea.  Hubby got a buffalo chicken salad.  We also don't have to wait for the tab and use the convenient machines on the tables to pay when we're ready.  THAT is the single best thing about this place as well.   I hope they fixed their leaking roof situation in the bar area, last time we had our meal with some indoor waterfalls.  While its not the best of food, its still pretty decently consistent and very convenient if you can get over the traffic from all the shopping.   I'd still go back when i have a hankering.

I always look be coming here because the waitress are really professional. Mexi is our favorite waitress. The food is always great and it's never too busy to watch a game. My favorite is the Texas Cheese fries   and the smoked wings. Both are game day worthy appetizers.

UPDATE (30 Sep 2017) Another outstanding meal at this popular location! This hot spot has a lively Saturday night crowd both in the bar and dining room. Jennifer rocked the service tonight, was both prompt and courteous, and didn't miss a beat with asking us if we wanted margaritas, and making sure that our glasses were never empty. Thanks again! This Chilis stands above the rest of the Oahu locations, and is the standard for others to follow. Outstanding service by Shayna, whose courtesy and prompt service ensured that our glasses were always filled and our food looked and tasted great; give her the "aloha spirit" award! This place highlights teamwork: when the soda machine's carbonation failed, her manager Triton quickly worked to get the drinks back up to standard. This location rocks, and I will come back again!

I've came to this location various times in the past years and will review based on our experience today.  We came on a Tuesday afternoon around 2:30pm and were welcomed as soon as we came in. There was no wait, and was seated right away. It was my boyfriend and I and my sleeping son in his stroller and they gave us a booth to accomodate his stroller which I love! We were asked if we wanted drinks as we sat and were checked on a lot along with many water refills without us having to ask. To start off we got the appetizer trio with the egg rolls, boneless buffalo wings, and onion rings and it was brought fresh and hot to our table within 5-10 minutes. We ordered the chicken crispers, side mac and cheese, extra honey mustard sauce, and the shrimp and steak fajita. All of our food came out by the time we were done with our appetizers which was execellent! No wait at all at this visit but which shkuld be expected aince they were not busy. We ordered our dessert, our favorite the chocolate molten lava cake, off the ziosk and it came within 5 minutes as well. Everything was tasty, delicious, and fresh with no complaints. I loved how our waitress anx staff always came to check on us and could do a little small talk as we enjoyed a peaceful lunch while our crazy, busy toddler took his nap. A chilis I've always returned to.  The ONE thing i do have to say though is as we were walking out, i was carrying my son and my boyfriend had the stroller and take out food. They have double doors for the entrance/exit. The hostess at the stand saw us walking out hands full and everything and said "Thank you!!... OH" and nothing after as she just watched us struggling to get everything through the double doors. I've been a hostess before. Yes you should always greet and thank, but also you should help customers with the doors when needed. Its part of their experience.  Please dont just watch.

This is my favourite Chilli's location. The service here is amazing and the food always tastes fresh. The wait times for food are relatively low even when really busy. The restaurant is clean and looks great. Whenever my husband and I feel like eating at Chilli's we always come to this location no matter what!

It was a chilly night, literally Chilis kind of night. We had a warm and cozy table near the window. The atmosphere was great and not crowded.  Our waitress was nice and she greeted us with a smile which is very rare now days. And she was the twin double of Ronda Rousey.  Free queso and chips for checking in Yelp was so bomb! My margarita was blazin just the way I like it. A waiter suggested a drink that they had but was not on the menu. The "Blue pacific". We enjoyed our margaritas a lot!  I had Triple Dipper and Southwestern Smokehouse Burger. The Tripple Dipper was a score. So much food for 14 bucks. I couldn't finish it all because of our free queso and chips. It was the same story with my girlfriend. We took it home. The customer service was nice enough to come and ask for boxes.  I would definitely come here again for some drinks and the dripple Dipper. The menu has great pictures to refer to and they have a screen to browse even more things on the menu. Our only suggestion is we wish they still have the Lava Float! We would have totally ordered.

I love Chili's but this time, I wasn't satisfied with our food. We waited for our food for one hour 1/2, this was the longest i waited for a food to be serve. And when we finally receive our food, it wasn't that hot or warm enough, the rice we got was hard as well. I wasn't able to enjoy it so I barely touch it, I guess our server saw how disappointed I was, so she was trying to give us free dessert as an apology for the wait... she explained that they were short so their manager was the one on the kitchen helping so I wasn't able to talk to him. I'll give two star for our server since she was trying her best to satisfy our needs, but overall dissatisfied the way they serve our food, I don't mind waiting but to wait that long and be served with food that is not even warm is just too much. I think it will be a while before I come here or not at all. And I'm not sure what's their definition of busy cause it didn't even looked packed inside.

Great service. Ordered a Tanqueray n Tonic.  Waitress comes back 2 minutes later sorry they don't have Tonic.  What?? Ok give me Sprite then.  2 minutes later sorry No Tangueray...ahahhaa - not the waitress fault. Food was great n service was awesome and they aired the PAC Man fight.

Everytime we pass a Chili's my son begs me to go and I almost always say no. This time I said okay, and I'm happy we went. We went around 11:30 am and were greeted and seated immediately. Although we don't come here to watch sports, the TVs had football games showing. My 7 year old son immediately went to play unlimited games on the Ziosk for $1.99. Our server, Maxie, appeared with a friendly smile to introduce herself and take our drink order. I think they changed their kids' cups because it was bigger and the kind you can't take home. I personally prefer the new cup because my son drinks a lot and we don't need more of them at our house. I was a little bummed they no longer had the buffalo cauliflower but consoled myself with their triple dipper with my favs of south western egg rolls, honey chipotle tenders, and panko onion rings. My son ordered the bacon quesadillas. I also decided to try their new black cherry lemonade. Definitely no disappointment there until maybe when it's replaced by a new flavor. I decided to check in on yelp and what do you know, free chips and queso! Oh my, just another appetizer my son fell in love with. Maxie was super awesome about bringing that out promptly and even refilling the chips and salsa. All the food was delicious and I like that about chain restaurants, they're pretty consistent on presentation, temperature, portion, and flavor. Oh and they take ID cards here in case you have one and would like a discount. Thank you Maxie and Chili's for another pleasant experience!

Went to Chili's Waikele to celebrate my brothers birthday. We had a party of 12 and we were all very impressed with the food. Five of us had the rib eye steak and it was so delicious and tender, highly recommend! We also had other dishes, loved the Crispy Chicken Sante Fe Salad and Crispy Asparagus also the Triple Dipper is always great! Ended the night with the best dessert Molten Chocolate Cake! We also had great service, our waitress Mexi was awesome and very attentive, giving us excellent customer service! I know it can be difficult when you have a big party, but she was so patient and loved her spirit!  We will definitely be back and hope Mexi will be our waitress again! Thank you for your hard work, we appreciate your service. May God Bless You! Aloha, Lisa and family!
Had dinner with gang after going to Rogue One! Service was excellent and food was ono!  And not smelly like the Pearl Ridge store!
This chili's has awesome burgers and super nice servers. Been here a few times, always tasty.
The size of the ribs in the smokehouse meal was ridiculously small..... waitress seemed decent and wait time was great (went on Wednesday night). Size of the ribs were pitiful.....
Our server was awesome and the food came out great! We are addicted to Chili's and will definitely be back!
Excellent place.  Best tex-mex on the island.
Stephanie was our waitress. She was super friendly and appeared to enjoy her job. Our glasses were always full. Food was fresh and it was served pretty darn quick. Great quality food. Will be back!!
Great place! Our waiter Jess was very polite, funny, and knows her drinks! The place was very well maintained as well. The food was awesome, great place to relax and eat with family and friends.

Sometimes there is a wait but you can call ahead. The service is always god and the restaurant is clean. I love the margarita chicken! All of the deserts are awesome and my kids love eating here. Also the table kiosk makes it easy to pay and leave when you need to.

My favorite location of them all. It's close to home, the decor is beautiful, service is awesome and the food here is the best. (In my opinion) I mean that literally, I've tried other locations. This one tastes the best for some reason..... Highly recommend this location to everyone in the area looking to grab dinner or a quick meal.

Really disappointed with this location. Came in and ordered the chips and dip which seemed to be the only appetizing thing I ate. I ordered the quesdilla explosion salad and it was disgusting. The salad was over dressed and didn't look anything like the picture on the menu. The menu had pictures of black beans and I counted 5 total, the salad was big but there was hardly any chicken. Server asked if I wanted a box and I said no, just paid my bill and left.
Love popping in for a margaritas and fish tacos. New items always being added to the menu so there's always something new to try. Monday's are $6 presidents margarita days.

This was my first time at a Chili's and it was an all around great experience. We were quick to be seated. Although we arrived during the last 15 min of happy hour and didn't sit in the bar area, our server still gave me the special on my margarita. There was also many vegetarian options which was awesome. I had the southern something burger with no bacon and added a black bean patty instead of the beef and it was sooooo good. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone. The staff was very attentive and friendly and the food was really good.

Seriously go here all the time, one of the few resturants chains from mainland that's actually good no offense to the island just hard to ship all the stuff here. I suggest getting the chips and salsa always because free refills!! Also strawberry mango margita is amazing here.
Standard chili's menu with an overwhelmed staff. Takes too long to get served -even at the bar.  Don't come here if you've only got an hour for lunch - you'll definitely be late heading back to work
We were seated immediately. Our food came in a timely manner, everything tasted good. Our server was very nice and always brought us refills.

Thank you to Chili's for an awesome free chips and dips with that tasty cheese bean dip....We Had an awesome server at the Kapolei Chili's and her name is Jennifer or Jen for short, so please ask for her when you plan on coming to eat here. You can experience the Love and Warmth that comes with the taste of the food and the joy from there smiles. Everyone here is Awesome I am just amaze cause it was packed and they handled this busy night smoothed and calmed. Awesome Job to everyone at Chili's Kapolei you folks really made our Ladies night So Faabuuuu. We look forward to coming more often. It's been awhile since I came here and you guys never seem to lose your guys touch. Keep up the "O" for Owesomeness....lol
Awesome Service by Christina aka Mexi. We knew would be an awesome experience from when she approached our table. Great server!
Love, love, love this place to dine in!!! They have great service and food.  We were in and out in 45 min.  Thanks Chili's Grill & Bar in Waikele!!!

This location is soo convenient to grab a quick dinner with friends or family.  The staff are super friendly greeting you as soon as you walk through the door.  There was a little bit of a wait considering it was busy that night.  And While waiting for our table I checked in on YELP and I found out  I hadn't used my freebie from YELP. After about 10 minutes we were seated and I mentioned the freebie....qNo Biggie they accepted it with a smile! Our Server was super friendly and made sure she got our order right. Our order came after about 15 minutes and it was Delish! Again, served with a smile!!  I love the great tasting food and the fun atmosphere there the only down side is the parking not enough for so many restaurants.

I've only been to this location and honestly, it's either a hit or miss depending on your server.   My husband and I along with our daughter eat here quite often for lunch, normally after our daughter's swimming lesson.  We always sit with Felicia, she already knows our drinks and that we always order the endless chips and salsa for our appetizer.  As soon as we sit she already has it coming out.  James is also another good server. At times when we go and they aren't working we are forced to sit with other servers....and we have sat with some that take an extremely long time to come to our table or we don't see them for quite awhile! Like our entire meal time! The food is always consistent and comes out hot which is great.

What can I say about this place... just totally fabulous from our last visit. Just the fact that it was a Saturday afternoon should speak volumes. Chili's Grill & Bar in Waikele, O'ahu, Hawai'i. My friends and I had a wonderful visit here. We enjoyed everything from the customer service to the great tasting food and very bubbly atmosphere. To begin our visit, from the time you walk into the restaurant the hostess was inviting and cheery and it didn't take long to get us seated as we could see that the restaurant was steady. Every employee had smiles on there faces so I know they enjoyed their jobs. We got seated and was greeted by this amazing waitress named Stephanie, pleasant and vivacious. After a long lunch, she had such energy and her customer service was spot on. She was informative about all the specials, gave great feedback on the food we ordered and made sure the quality of our food was immaculate before she served it. Our food had great temperature and tasted like it should have, DELICIOUS! Shephanie's manager had to come and seen us because one of the food items didn't look right and explained why it would take a few more minutes for guacamole to be done. Since the guacamole didn't look as expected, they were making a new batch and we thought it was awesome to know Kat the manager was able to communicate with her patrons.  When our meal was through, they didn't rush us out of the restaurant like most establishments do these days. Stephanie simply refilled our glasses and asked if we'd like dessert but we couldn't eat another bite. All in all, I recommend this location for a warm and wholesome experience everyone should enjoy.
Me and my husband just ate dinner here and it was the bomb dot com, I ordered a half rack of ribs with a side of mac and cheese and he ordered the smokehouse combo! Definitely will be returning!

My new favorite place. The price is cheap compared to other similar franchise restaurants. You get free queso and chips if you check in! I like the steak and loaded mash or the Cajun pasta! I get the lava cake for dessert. Service is fast and nice
Lunch is always amazing here! Love coming by. Our waitress was great. Ready to eat now

As much as I love Chili's food, today my rate is for the customer service that I received from our waiter Jordan.  He is a rare one.  He was so attentive to our needs and went above and beyond to ensure that we were comfortable.  Now when I say we, I mean one baby, 2 toddlers, 2 kids (9 & 11yrs) and 3 adults. It was a full table and not only was he on it with our food and drinks order, he made sure to keep checking in if we needed anything. With all these kids, you betcha we needed things (napkins, refill, sauces, etc.).  Even when we were about to leave he made sure to pack all the sauces and extra chips for the kids to take home. Thanks Jordan! This will be gone by the time we get home.  Because of you, I know I will be back here at Chili's Waikele for another amazing meal. Five stars to you
Our food was amazing. Our waiter? Not really. She had a bad attitude. Her name is Carrie? Maybe she would've gotten a full tip had she been a lot better at her service.

Overall, great date night joint! The wait time was decent for a Friday night, only waited about 10 minutes. Our server was delightful; she was chipper and very sweet. She gave us great recommendations because we hadn't eaten at Chilli's in awhile. The food came out within 15 minutes, just enough time to eat our free Yelp check-in chips and queso.  My husband ordered the shrimp and prime rib tacos which he enjoyed a lot, said he'd get them again next time. I ordered the Mexican salad bowl with chicken and I liked it. It slightly reminded me of Chipotle from the mainland. Lastly, the dessert! I'm a dessert kind of gal and I know what's good when it comes to sweets. The lava cake was mmmmmm and it was gone it two minutes.

The toffee dessert w/ ice cream and brownie is a little overpriced but I left the restaurant feeling really full and satisfied. Got the Fajitas mixed w/seared shrimp and steaks. Babe ordered the 3 mixed choices of quesadilla and we had the queso with chips on the side. Our server was awesome, she gave us extra quesadillas. Awesome experience, definitely coming back even thought the wait was long!

Had dinner there tonight because one of my besties decided she wanted to get this expectant mama exactly what she was craving; steak & mashed potatoes. Upon arriving, we were seated by the hostess & introduced to our AMAZING waitress, Kristen  Kristen was so polite, sweet and energetic, & never failed to check on us throughout the evening. So fast forward to after receiving our order.. being 3 1/2 months pregnant, I had to order my steak WELL DONE & cause the cravings for mashed potatoes was REAL... I ordered 2 sides (replacing the broccoli with mash) of the loaded mash. She hadn't brought out the food to us (another waiter had) but that didn't bother us. I cut into the meat and honestly couldn't really tell if it was well done or not, cause I'm always a medium rare kind of girl and it seemed OKAYYYYY to me. But a little while later... she came to check on us and she was like "Oh no girl, that is NOT well done! I'm taking that back for you. I'm so sorry" I don't like to be a person that ever has to send my food back so I wouldn't have said anything when I did start noticing a lil bit of a pinker meat. Anyhow, she took it to the back, brought me back a side of mash to munch on in the meantime while they made me a whole new 10 Oz steak! She apologized again and reassured me my food would be out shortly. The manager then brought me out my new plate, with 2 sides of mash as well! It was like I hadn't even previously had a plate at all! But I very well did finish one whole side of mash on the first plate as well as half through the steak. Upon making sure the steak was well done, the manager apologized again & offered us free dessert on her. Their service was ABOVE AND BEYOND... they were all very energetic, polite, and showed sincerest apologies when I didn't even feel they needed to apologize that much but appreciated it. That is exactly how customer service should be done  I would highly recommend this location and of course, my brothers & sisters in Christ love Chilis! So I would recommend Chilis overall. If you want one of the best servers... go in on Saturdays since Kristen only works then.
Horrible. Waited 10 minutes once seated and not a single person acknowledged our presence. Never going back again.

This is our go-to spot for good food with a good price. As with any restaurant, service quality depends on the server. Colton is easily one of the best servers at this location, with Lindsey and Kayla also being excellent. Those 3, plus the consistent quality of the food here, make this one of my family's places to eat at regularly.

I have to admit, service at Chili's have been going downhill over the past few years. However, this particular visit, the service was excellent. I really enjoyed the variety and new menu items. We were able to taste a few things that were not there before, very well done. I think I may be trying this location again.

This place never lets me down. My brother and I are having lunch. Our waitress today is ON IT! Not busy. We came in about 2pm. Our food was quick. The quality was YUMMY! The ribs my brother got today were sooooooo much better compared to the last time we ordered. We love coming here! Keep it up Chilis Waikele!!

I went here for lunch today. I ordered the Margarita Chicken. It's on the healthy options menu. It usually comes with rice with seasonings, black beans and a marinated chicken breast. I got the asparagus and cherry tomatoes instead of the rice. As I wanted a low carb meal. It was delicious!!!! They put the chicken over the asparagus, which in turn seasoned the asparagus even more! On top of the chicken was pico de gallo. The black beans were on the side in a small bowl.  The chicken was seasoned so well and cooked to perfection! The asparagus was barely cooked, same for the cherry tomatoes. It was good, but I've had them better at different Chili locations. The black beans were so so delicious!  The service was very slow. As the servers were changing shifts. But as soon as we got a new server, the food came out quickly and drinks were filled. Everything was filling!

Came in for happy hour, but couldn't get happy hour prices because it's only at their "lounge." We even told the person at the front that we we here for happy hour. The service was crappy and the workers like to engage in conversations obnoxiously in the back by the bathrooms instead of refilling our waters or taking our drink orders.  Also, the lady at the front would sit on the benches from time to time, minutes long.  The food came out cold. Chips were stale and the burger was dry.

First of all Kelly, I just have to say we loved having Josiah as our waiter at Waikele!! He's so friendly, great service!! He is quite the asset to your company!! The free queso and chips was a bonus!! My little one tried your baby back ribs for the first time and ate half of my husbands dinner!! My husband said its just as good as mine!! If I don't have to cook it then that's good for me!! Keep that special with the fries and sale with molten chocolate cake!!! Coming back sooner than later!!
Service was wonderful. Food was horrible. Many of our items were stale, burned, or unflavored. We will not come back again.
Service was slow and when I asked for a container to put the left overs in they never came back with it so I left.
I usually have to rush the few occasions I get a long lunch. I always sit at the bar & Alaina always makes me feel welcome and makes sure I am well taken care of.

Dined in tonight waited about 5-10 minutes to get seated, after 5 minutes our "server" said she would be right with us. In the 30 minutes of us waiting she continued to serve other tables as we tried getting her attention. My bf and I decided if she didn't come to our table by 9:15 we were over it. (We didn't even have waters) but by the grace of god, a different server comes to us and helps us. Didn't catch his name, but he has braids. He turned our night upside down, his service was INCREDIBLE. He was constantly apologizing and rushing through all his tables, you could tell he was picking up the slack from others I mean he picked up our table when our original server didn't bother to do her job. He kept making sure we were alright and took care of us. We appreciate your hard work, mahalo for the good service man!

I was anticipating a long wait time since it was on a Sunday evening, but we were seated less than 15 minutes with a party of 8. Not too bad! Our waitress, Mexi was very on point this evening. My husband usually has very high standards when it comes to dining in especially with our 6 children, but we were able to enjoy ourselves for a change! No kids screaming and yelling and running around thanks to the kiosk games they have! Mexi was very attentive and always checking in on us! She is very friendly and we could use more of her!!! Thanks for a great quite and relaxing dinner

Poor customer service!!!! Called in a phone order, went to pick it up 20 minutes later only to find out they screwed up my order. Waited another 30 minutes to find out they were still making my order. Asked for a manager and he couldn't explain why my order was taking so long. Never coming back to this Chili's!!

What can I say, I never had a long wait at this place at the door or at the table, the servers are friendly, know their menu, they have a lot of beer choices on tap and their always improving their service and menu. The appetizers are similar to the other chain restaurants (I.e. Apple bees, ruby Tuesday, outback) IMO and in the sense where If I tried to recall a particular appetizer wouldn't remember which chain I had it at. Not the less; I would gladly return for food and beer anytime!

I love coming on Sundays when I get a day off! Mama Tracy is always taking care. I love her service and her personality. She's always checking up on us, never a drink half empty. Love coming here just to see her. Thank you for your service mama!

5/5 stars for my server Mexi! She was very personable & attentive to our party. Although we came in late & were probably one of the last parties of the night, she didn't rush us with our meal. She was quick to take orders & often checked if we were doing ok. Food was great!

The normal Chili's fare.  My favorites are the chick fajitas and the pan chocolate chip cookie.  Amazing. Not sure I'd recommend solo dining after a hard day's work, but I have had one good experience here with a really good server.  This particular one is busier than I'd like due to it being in the Waikele Outlet area, so, if I do happen to go, it's late in the evening to avoid the rush.  The prices are a bit expensive compared to the mainland but such is the case with most things on island since shipping costs come into effect.

A quarter of the place is empty; 25 minute wait?  This is typical of Chili's customer focus. We have never been surprised by lackluster service or food. This concept has so much potential. Heard three groups come in after us questioning the wait.  Fail.

Went here just this past Sunday after church. We were told the wait would be about 15mins but they took us earlier with a wait of 5mins. Where we sat was a little small since my toddler was asleep, so they generously loved us to a bigger table where i could lay him down to sleep. Our waiter was Maxine. My kids absolutely loved her! Ive never heard my kids ever praise the waiter/waitress, so this spoke volumes for me. She helped us with our order, checked us on us often. It was a busy day but she managed to stay on top of it. I'd definitely go again thanks to her service.

I enjoyed a 3 Course Dinner special for $15.99. It's for a limited time only so get it before it's gone. Now for the delicious courses that I selected. 1) Fresh House Salad. 2) Sizzling Chicken Fajitas. 3) Mini Molten Cake. Be sure to checkin with your Yelp app and show the waiter or waitress your Yelp special to get a free serving of Chips and Queso. It's so delicious and it compliments your meal. We got a table so fast. The food came out fast too. The quality of the food was pure delicious and the service is excellent. Very nice place for family and friends or just a date night. Seen a bunch of Birthday celebrations there too.

My friends and I continue to frequent this location. Service is always stellar, but on this particular night, we had a server named Richard.  Super friendly, funny, and personable. He checked on us often, but wasn't intrusive.  We ordered chips and salsa for 5 of us and he was generous enough to bring us two baskets and lots of salsa. Lots of chips are definitely a plus in my book.  There are lots of new items available on their seasonal menu.  If you haven't been to Chili's in a while, drop by.

I just love the food here. They have also freebies if you sign up and like the FB page.  My ultimate favorite was the baby back ribs and the flat bread. My husband surprised me to have dinner on my birthday.  A lot of choices and they serve good food. The staff  were very accommodating.
Very disappointing not having SALSA with chips.... waiter said they ran out of salsa and substitute with ranch dressing !!!

This is a fantastic place to eat!  The food and drinks were both delicious and reasonably priced.  Our server Jordy was excellent as well - super friendly and efficient.  We will definitely be back.  Thank you :)

My Go - To Restaurant up the street from my house. I always come here if other food places are busy. The Waikele area, how ever has a small parking for people who comes during the busy hours. This Chili's restaurant, just recent renovated their seats & their counters. It's very uniformed & more cleaner environment.  One big tip for Chilis, all over the island is the FREE Queso when you check in! I always forget to check in but I always show the waiters the Yelp account. Nothing wrong with free food right?! :D I highly recommend triple dipper & their quesadillas are good! I love how they have refills on the lemonades. I prefer the Strawberry Lemonade the BEST! Did I say free refills?! Yes FREE REFILLS. Go get it! Our waitress refill our drinks about 3x. (Yes, we gave her a plus on tip of course!  She was on it with refilling our drinks without even saying anything) Lol.

AlohaReader:This particular chilis has a very Awesome atmosphere, we was seated very quikly. Food same everywhere. Drinks where yummie, tried the new Blueberry&of course magaritas made and shaked to perfection. All the chili employess worked together& we always had water and our table stayed clear of unwanted dishes, thankyou so much. Will be making the drive to this particular location soon.

I was Very disappointed.  After placing an order the waiter returned 20-30 minutes later to retake our order claiming that he didnt see our order in the kitchen. The waiter got very defensive about who was responsible for the order going missing and offered no apology for the inconvenience.  The manager then came to the table to apologize, from a customer service level I can appreciate that she did this considering we did not ask to speak to the manager.  That was the WOW and the only reason we will come back. Its hard to find businesses these days who Own up to their mistakes and genuinely go the extra mile for their customers. I believe chili's waikele is a business of Integrity and they truly value their consumers. Best customer service  I have ever seen.

Waited a while for someone to help us but as soon as our server Colten came he gave excellent service! Very friendly and energetic :)  Overall Colten made up for the 10 minute wait after being seated.. thanks Colten for the outstanding service!

I usually come to this chili's and almost get good service every time. However, I had to write a yelp review because our server, Mexi, took really good care of my family and I. Her service was great and fast starting from getting our waters all the way up to dessert. She was very observant of our table and checked up on us enough to see how we were doing. Lastly, when I asked for a takeout box for our chips and queso, Mexi gave us a fresh new bag of chips and salsa (which was a major bonus).  It was one of the best visits I had at this chilis.

We have traditionally banned all Chili's due to lack of service and poor food quality, but since we were at Waikele's, opted for this place.  We went on a Monday around 1pm. We were seated quickly so that was great. We had the cheese fries with extra jalapeño. I have to say, they were delish. I would def have them again. Sadly, our meals were not on the same caliber. I ordered cheese enchiladas. Barely edible. It tasted like it was loaded with sliced american cheese. The rice was either undercooked or fried too long as it was hard. I don't like black beans so can't comment on that. The kid had 1/2rack of ribs with rice. Her rice was hard as well. The ribs had little meat and lots of inedible parts. My man ordered the 3pc something or other. Spring rolls, fried pickles and 2 sliders. He saved his food for dinner as he was already full from the appetizers. The pickles def had a tangy punch when you chewed it. The slices were thicker than what you would traditionally get at a bar. The dip it came with was good. So I'd rate the pickles as ok. Can't tell u about the spring rolls or sliders. Ut since he ate them later that night, I'll assume they were ok. Our waitress came and refilled our drinks several times, so a plus for service. Also, having checked in on Yelp, we received a free basket of chips and salsa with a bean dip. Not a meat eater, I realized I was chomping on something that felt "meaty/chewy". It was confirmed so I stopped eating it. But the bean part was tasty. I also don't care for super thin chips, so not a deal-breaker.  If we went again, I'd stick to my usual of veggie burger. Can't go wrong with a standard. I'll leave the Mexican dishes to a Mexican restaurant as well. And ribs...well, a rib or steakhouse joint. But the cheese fries were a winner.

When you're in a big group (we had 10 including some kids), good service isn't always easy to find.  A busy Saturday night adds another challenge, but Kayla handled our group like a pro!  She's one of the main reasons I'm giving a 5-star rating.  She  made sure to check on us, bring us what we asked for in a timely manner, and refilled drinks without prompting.  And she constantly kept a smile on her face!   Food was good.  My inlaws aren't big eaters, and they were able to split a burger (again, good service - Kayla had the burger cut already when it was served, and each had their own plate!).  Chili, Ribs, fajitas, a Sunrise Burger, a Sirloin steak and grilled cheese filled up the rest of the table.  Everyone enjoyed their meals  - not culinary perfection, but not far off from the menu pictures.  We appreciated that; sometimes, the food that's delivered is a bit different than what's pictured. Good food coupled with an excellent server...we'll be back and hope that the rest of the staff is as accommodating and cheerful.  Thanks Kayla!

Was seated right away since I was a party of one it was easy. They were busy and the place was very noisy but the new menu rocks! Not sure if this menu is unique to the island or not but I ordered the prime rib tacos and the were delish..service took a bit but once my waitress showed up I was satisfied.

Great fast service, very clean, really friendly, view outside (not enclosed with walls), natural light from windows. Had a very good experience.   We ordered the cheeseburger (little greasy) and chicken enchilada (satisfied) Little pricey, but your paying for the service, atmosphere, a personal moment with a special one, or just a peaceful place to get away from it all.

You can't go wrong with Chili's.  Its not fine dining but it's a step above home food.    Check-in and receive a free Skillet Queso, normally a $9 appetizer.  Plus you get unlimited, freshly made, tortilla chips.  More often than not they send you home with a complimentary bag of chips.      Their burgers are always delicious and so is their Margarita Fresh Mex Bowl.  Kids are always content with their meals too.    Unfortunately they no longer have kids coloring menues, those have been replaced with these little game/ordering screens.  Watch your kids though, easy for them to click a game and most all of them cost money to play.    Would I return? Of course, they're consistently good and that is enough reason!

Thank you Chili's....thank you, thank you, thank you!  What a different experience my family had at your Waikele location today.   Enter server Felicia!  She was gracious, smiling the whole time, attentive, and caring.  She took our drink orders almost immediately, kept the glasses full, took my 'free' order of queso and chips (compliments of checking in on YELP!) with no problem, and made recommendations off the menu.  Felicia is exactly what fantastic service looks like in the restaurant industry...one of the best I've ever had! The food was high quality today, the pricing just fine, and Felicia sent us on our way with a complimentary bag of chips, sauces, and salsa.  My oh my, it made me want to hire her for Bank of Hawaii!! Thank you Chili's, and thank you Felicia...don't change!  You're a winner!!

Quoted 20 mins for a party of 8. I don't mind a wait, but I do care when they seat every party mix after me, including a party of 12, then tell me the only available seating is back to back tables. In other words if they had planned accordingly we could have had at least sat side by side, even if an aisle was between us. I've never dined at Chilis since they out the table side kiosk.  Who knew it'd allow the children to purchase premium games without consent, which you won't find out until you pay your bill. It's bad enough that the servers depend on the system for you to order and pay your bill, but they hardly come by to service your table. The entree order our server did take, she got majority of it wrong, but because she failed to check on us and the fact we waited almost 35 mins to seat. We just consumed what we could. I doubt I'll return

Chili's use to be a place I love when I was back in Alabama, but Hawaii has funny way of messing up a lot of restaurants for me. HOW DO YOU MESS UP A SIMPLE HOUSE SALAD?!!! I didn't think it was possible until I tried the soup and salad. Now, the only reason this review is even getting 2 stars is because the loaded potato soup is always bomb. However, my salad was dry. I never thought I'd say that about a salad, but my cucumber had no kind of hydration. My croutons were stale. Praise sweet baby Jesus that I asked for 2 salad dressings to be able to remotely eat the salad!
Great experience at this Chilis. Drinks were strong and tasted great. I got a salad and my friend got enchiladas. They were prepared quickly and absolutely delicious!
Great food!  We went on Cinco de mayo but they didn't have any drink specials but food was great!

Had to grab lunch and this place sounded real good other than McDonalds. The only place I'll grab my salad that is nearby. Brought my two girls here and they have the ziosk which my girls want to play on it. Need to bring my mini iPad instead of paying 1.99 for unlimited games

Today's experience was terrible.  We waited over an hour for our food.  Granted they did bring us a free chips and salsa, but the waitress must have been new.  I try to give them the benefit of the doubt but when I have to wait a long time for drinks and at the end of our stay, I asked for another soda and she never brought it.  She asked me twice if I wanted another refill and I told her yes twice and never got it.  If asked to go back, I may suggest going to Mililani where my experience has been great.

Happy hour!!! Did you know if you sit on the bar side, you get happy hour prices during happy hour? But if you sit on the restaurant side, you get regular priced drinks during happy hour? Aaaaaaahhhh! I bet you didn't know that!

Sunday night and no line outside! Our server, Tracy,(the potagee princess) was very attentive, helpful and lots of fun. We shared the appetizer Queso with spinach, chicken flathead, and soup and salad. It was so filling and delicious. Paid at the table automatically. So convenient.

Walked in asked for a table for one. Was told 5 minutes, no problem.  Promptly sat. Waited 5 more minutes no service.  I walked to to the front desk and asked about service.  Classic reply, "we're sorry have a nice night." Never again. Will not recommend to any of my government friends.
I enjoyed my server mexi, she was very polite and down to earth. I would come back to the establishment because of her and her great customer service.

I came here the other night to celebrate my friends birthday.  The waitress was awesome. Good service and stuff. I felt bad for her cause she had to deal wit alot of people in my party.  But the reason y im giving 3 stars is because towards the ending of our night we was waiting for our food and the manager comes out says if you guys want dessert please let us know asap because the kitchen closes in 5 mins. Im like wth? But ok. Im pretty sure if you work in a restaurant your not suppose to do that to the customers by rushing them.  I also heard that she was giving people their checks while their eating. I find that very rude. Your suppose to give the customers their check at the end when they are done eating n stuff just in case if they want to order something else.  I always come to this chilis and i actually never had any problems before. This was the best chilis but not that night. The manager was jus not cool.  But im pretty sure the mangers name is gladys.  The waiters and waitresses of this restaurant is super good. They all nice and stuff. Do I recommend coming here again? Maybe. Not sure on that because of that night. But probably not.
Service was slow. Had to wait 15mins to get check after asking for it then had to go find the waitress who was talking and joking in the kitchen in order to have the bill settled.

We had dinner there, and it wasn't that busy.  We were seated as soon as we walked thru 2 doors.  Hostess sat us on a table for 6 and it was just me & my husband.  We ordered 2 dish and it took over 38 minutes.  Got checked on onced from our waitress and finally asked us if we wanted a refill on our drinks.  Over all, it'll probably be awhile before we return.

Originally intended to dine in at Kunio's but I was super hungry & the wait at Kunio's was an hour so my bf & I decided to have dinner here instead. I'm so glad we did because we were beyond satisfied with our food (maybe because both of us were starving, but we were satisfied nonetheless). We were seated right away, got our appetizer within a few minutes & our main dishes also came in a timely manner. Definitely coming back here!

The food is always good, no matter the selections from appetizers to entrees - all are great!  A few things I enjoy eating at Chili's is their Tortilla Chicken Enchilada Soup! Lunch or dinner, it's always a must for me to have - cup or bowl.  Next is their endless Chips and Salsa! You can't go wrong when you have this all you can eat snack! It's even awesome when you have a good waiter or waitress that gets you a To-Go bag and foam bowl to take home this awesome snack! Can't forget their Strawberry Lemonade! I can take a gallons worth by the end of the night! Also awesome when a waiter or waitress lets you take a To-Go cup home of this great nectar on your travels home.  Sadly - the only part of this experience being poor is the waiters and waitress. It's sad to go with a group of 8 or more and expect to pay gratuity of 18% tip when service is really poor. Waiters and Waitresses being asked numerous of times for the same items and not paying attention when customers drinks are low or empty plates crowd the table. Even on nights when it's not busy, the service seems to stay the same. But I still enjoy the food and drinks!  My tip would be to find a good waiter or waitress and go there during their shifts. Your dining experience will be better!
We've been coming to this Chili's for ages!!! Food is great and comes out in a timely manner. We always request Mexi, she goes above and beyond and we love her!

This was a second time this restaurant.  Because first time was very good.  First time,  party of four,  second time three.  We ordered quacamole plater.  This time less than first time. Same price. Why? We guess trying to save avocado.  Chips were old,  not crispy,  many cramps.  Ordered second tortilla chips,  they're fresh.  Why?  Gave us someone's leftover.  Foods were very good.   Please don't cheat.

Had the Deep Eddy Peach Cooler and it's as good as ever!   Thank you Yelp for the Chips and Queso! That was delicious.  Even though we had a rough start with the hostess, our waitress made up for that with her attentive service. Tried the combo with 3 different enchiladas today it was good.

As we started our day shopping in the area.  Every store treated us like we were ghost.  We got to Chili's for a quite lunch.  To our amaze.  Now we were King and Queen.  Our server Felicia was great.  Food came out quickly and refreshing our drinks before it running low is awesome.  It's rare to receive this kind of service.  Food was great also.
Our server, Mexi, was awesome! Super enthusiastic, fun, and quick. Great service always makes the food taste better than it already was!
Great food! Great server!(Her name is Mexi) We love this Chili's and can't wait to come back. It's always great here

Kaylas service tonight was outstanding, her promptness and attention to detail are spot on. Checked in and received the always hot and cheesy queso dip. Also got a ribeye and it was outstanding, cook to the perfect temperature. Their teamwork was also spot on. Very memorable visit.

This place is a little on the pricy side but their food is good! The servers especially tend to be experience and know the menu inside out! The wait is reasonable in proportion to how crowded it is so you can tell how long it may take by looking at how busy it is. If you are on the wait list there was comfy seats to wait on unlike most restaurants.

Went there with some of my family for my daughters bday yesterday. Everything got to the table pretty fast, and the server Holton or Colton? Dude was top notch. Food was good too, but the great service made my daughters special day even better....Great job guys!

Ive been here many times over the last decade. Always superb service and excellent food. Never a bad experience only great memories! I remember years ago hearing that Chilis was going out of business, and I thought of this place and was very sad. Im glad this company has stuck it out over the hard times with the economy!
Great margaritas. The food is good. It's a fun place to hang out with friends. Freindly staff

The 5 stars is reflective of all of our visits at this location (about 4-5 trips since moving just minutes away August).  I'll focus on tonight's trip... We have a 2-month-old baby who gets very comfortable once in her stroller. The hostess originally suggested a table for us but said we'd have to take the car seat part out and leave the stroller in front... When I asked if we could keep the stroller, she immediately offered to accommodate us and didn't even seem the least bit annoyed. She seated us and our babe (w/ stroller) immediately and with a smile.  We were off to a great start. Our waiter, Colton, was equally amazing. He was sweet, attentive and patient. When the bar ran out of Coors light, he offered my hubby the larger sized beer at no charge to apologize for the inconvenience. The food was awesome. I never thought I'd crave chilis but this location has blown me away with a couple of dishes.  We have yet to be disappointed at this location. Not sure how they only have 3 stars but I'm glad we live so close by! Love this place!

By far the best chilis I have ever been too. And our server Jen (the asian) sets the standard to superior customer service. Her attention to detail of our table has never been matched. Always keeping the tables beverages full and making sure everything is above standards. Thanks for an awesome Visit I will definitely be coming back.
This is our first time to Chili's in Hawaii and it was a great dinning experience!!! Our waiter Colton was the best and manger Joy very friendly . Great service thanks guys

For the price you pay here the food is just okay.  The fajitas trio we ordered was mediocre at best, there were more veggies than meat, it needed more season.  I'm not sure how you are suppose to make more than 1-2 fajitas with the portion of guacamole and tomatoes they give it is about 1-2 tablespoon. The carnitas was cold and the rice was too hard to eat.  My daughter enjoyed her meal so that was a plus and the drinks we ordered were fine.

I had lunch on 05/28 around 2:00 pm. Not so busy but yet had to wait. Table for 2 took about 10 mins. Yelp check-in gave me Chips and Queso. Followed by Tacos and Margherita pizza. Food was just about okay. Waitress started off a bit rude but sobered down later. They billed me for the chips and Queso which was later removed when I pointed out. Waitress blamed the manager. I have had better food definitely. Will not be back. The electronic gadget on the table was mistook by me as a way of placing my order without the aid of a server. I was trying to use it and they billed me a few of $1.99 which was removed when pointed out. A small note would help other customers.

I ordered one of the combos, (ribs, corn on the cob, chicken, Fries, garlic bread) They FORGOT my corn, my chicken was Cold AND I needed to repeatedly ask for my drink to be refilled. The ribs & rest of our foods was great though.

Positive streak broken, Chili's to go FAIL. Picked up some food for a friend & I to indulge in some guilty pleasures while watching the sunset on the north shore. And being that Chili's Waikele has been super on it the last few months, I was happy to order from them. Ordered a burger no red onions and the triple dipper (onion rings, cheddar bites, Boneless chicken wings). Simple. Not so much. While I was on the phone with Tim, he didn't ask about how I wanted the burger cooked. No problem. So I let him know I wanted the burger cooked to medium (meaning some pink in the middle). He didn't get what I was asking for and had me repeat it 3 more times. I was able to pick it up 15 minutes after calling it in. I get there and Tim confirms only the burger part of my order repeating no red onions & cooked medium, but only said triple dipper when confirming the 2nd half. Didn't think anything of it until now. But seriously, why not just be consistent and follow through if you think it's important to make sure it's right. Well, here we are opening up the food...the triple dipper had big mouth bites. Not crispy cheddar bites. Mind you, which sounds nothing alike aside from the "bites." Normally I'd be flexible and just go with it. But let's get to the regular sized burger we ordered....it was cooked well done. When you bit into it it was not tender, juicy like a medium burger would be. It was chewy, crumbly and on the dry side. Big appetite turn off. And if they can't get the regular burger right, it's hard for me to believe they could get the mini burgers right. Huge disappoint and an even bigger waste of money. I wonder if take out orders are served at a lesser standard where quality doesn't matter.

I always come here with family or friends and everything is always good. From the service to the food... It's always good. Tonight I tried the margherita flatbread for the first time. I don't why I never ordered this before. You gotta try it! I must say that even though we came here late tonight, they still treated us good and with an attitude like " we gonna close soon so hurry up." I also got the free queso n chips with my yelp app. Chips were a little salty tonight but it's usually not. All in all, great place to eat.
