The parking here at Waikele is just sucky everytime unless you get lucky. This is just automatic over here so don't be too picky and just choose the parking by Lowes. The service here.... What service anymore? Lol they switched to these iPad-like devices and that's for the most part how you order, pay, and play games. BEWARE however about the games. The games are $1.99 and they don't clearly say you pay for the games. Me and my gf started to play and thought the games were free. We should've known better than to think anything now these days are free. After you get mad at the fact that you paid for games without knowing, at least you'll be entertained by the receipt printing function that comes with it. I thought that was something... The food here is good for the most part. Take advantage of your check-ins here because they give free salsa and chips with it. Me and my gf always get the tripple dipper here. The sliders are pretty good, the egg rolls are crunchy and splendid, the honey bbq chicken is saucey and pretty good, and the onion rings are okay. I just wish that they had three different sauces like before. They only had ranch sauce with the triple dipper just recently.  The desserts are okay too. The molten chocolate is wayyyyy to chocolatey. If you love chocolate then I suggest getting this but if you don't wanna be diabetic, I suggest not getting this. The cookie in the pan was good and it comes with ice cream.

I'm not usually a fan of Chilis. I mean, it's just okay. But I went to this location to have lunch and it was a pleasant experience.  I checked into Yelp and got a cool offer for free chips and queso! Totally awesome. A $6.99 appetizer for free! And it's so much cooler because it's one of my favorites at Chilis. We also had the complimentary chips and salsa given to us as well. I got the Margarita Tex Mex bowl, which comes with fresh greens, grilled chicken, beans, pico de gallo and sliced avacados on top a bed of Mexican rice. This dish was nice and light for lunch. I really liked it. Our food and drinks came out lightning fast and service was friendly.

Delicious chips with their queso! It's been 2 years since I have been here and now i am back!!!!! Walked  in last minute right before their closing time and the gentlemen at the entrance was more than happy to get me seated. Thank you to the employees here that were working during May 8, 2015 at 11:00pm for being professional and welcoming me with positive energy.  My waitress Chantelle was patient with me and helped me with figuring out my orders which turned out smoothly. She was consistent with filling my cup of water which impressed me because every time I eat dinner I drink a lot of water literally ALOT of water cause I get so thirsty from along day of work. Not a lot of people that accommodate me for the very first time gets it right but the employees here got it on point! Very attentive and caring always checking up on me. I give credit to the back kitchen also! Food came out perfect timing, my spicy chicken came out right and I enjoyed eating their smoked chicken with bacon and avocado flatbread. To be honest their chicken tasted a lot cleaner than another place I am a regular at so looks like I will be coming back often hopefully not too late.  My most recent experience here turned out great. Unfortunately this time I didn't get the chance to eat dessert I got too full but that's okay there is always next time and I will be sure to update my review :)

Quick service. Amazing food, got the new char rusted sirloin on their new Spring 2016 menu, soo good that garlic crust was amazing. We had a wonderful server name Tracy, she was super helpful, friendly and on point with our orders. Ask for her!! Thanks Tracy you the bomb!!!
Smothered prime rib burrito was da bomb!!  Love the onion rings too!  My daughter loves the crispy chicken crispers!

Yelp check-in offer: free bottomless chips with queso (and salsa).  Mix & match make it a trio fajitas Cadillac style is more than enough for my family of four. although the menu lists the condiments that accompany the fajitas, they no longer automatically give you everything. they only give the basic lettuce, sour cream, and guacamole. you need to ask for everything else.  Service is hit or miss....all depends on the server IMO.

Great service normally from Servers, but when we came in 11/20 for an early dinner, the Chefs took forever to get our food out.  The place was not busy, and our Server could not give us any estimated time of when to expect it.
I'm assuming this is the Waikele Chilis This one is our favorite one. Great service is key and they have yet to disappoint us.

So we decided to get a late lunch at the Waikele Chili's, waited a few minutes (as to be expected since this is always a busy site) and got our table. They asked if we needed a high chair (had the grandbaby with us) and set us up in a back area, near the kitchen. No problems with the seating, and they gave us lots of space (4 adults and a baby). The waitress was nice, but to no fault of hers, the cooks were awful. We ordered our drinks and appetizers, and when the Texas cheese fries came out, it was not... acceptable. I am not usually one to send things back, but I sent those cheese fries back as soon as she set them on the table. They were burnt, the cheese was no where to be seen, and it looked like it was sitting under the warmer light for an hour. She brought us another Texas fries, which looked a little better, but not by much. My order was for 2 enchiladas, with "all rice" (no beans). When my plate came out, it looked like they started to put beans on the plate, then removed the beans to give me all rice. It looked like a skid mark of beans on the edge of the plate. I get it, it was a mistake, but maybe take some pride in your work and wipe the mistake off! I wasn't about to send it back, since it didn't affect me one way or the other, but I was just like wth?  Nail in the coffin: we were at the end of our meal, and then it sounds like some of the kitchen staff went on break or they were hanging out around the corner. Either way, we couldn't see them, but we could definitely hear them. F-this and F-that. I'm not a prude, I drop the F-bomb myself, but these guys are in hearing range of me and my family, which i'm dropping $90 for a family meal and I gotta hear swearing after an extremely mediocre meal....their saving grace was the waitress, otherwise it would've been 1 star for my experience this weekend.

came here for lunch today. wait wasn't long 5 - 10 minutes. i had the prime rib mex bowl and my husband had the sweet and smokey burger. which was AWESOME! the prime rib mex bowl  had a little kick of spice which is great because i'm not too much of a spicy food kind of girl but i enjoyed the prime rib mex bowl. i always order their blackberry iced tea, i always have to have it...it's so DELICIOUS!! our server was attentive.

The parking leaves a lot to be desired (after all...it is holiday season and this restaurant shares parking with other restaurants and shops), but the food and atmosphere make it worth it. I'm liking the Cajun Chicken Pasta with my fave drink here: the Rita trio samples three different margaritas... Yummy! Save room for the Chocolate Molten Lava Cake with vanilla ice cream for dessert and some coffee and you'll be a happy camper!

For reals?!?!  Ok the ribs were horrible...place wasn't packed and service was Slow.  It took forever for me to get my pupus...and when I asked if they would change the channel to the fight as all tvs were on the same channel, they told me no.  They can't turn on the fight because it's a family friendly restsurant.  Hahaha, are you kidding me??  In a restaurant with a bar, AT the bar.  What a joke!  Highly recommend brick oven pizza or buffalo wild wings.

At the top of the "Places I go because my dining companion requests it specifically" list.  Also because I have the misfortune of living close to it, and sometimes it is all that can be agreed to. My two least favorite comments when I tell people I live in Waikele 1. Wow, you must go shopping all the time! (Yes I do, just not at the outlets!) 2. Wow, so close to Chili's.  You must eat there all the time! (Why would anyone eat here all the time??  Why?) The menu never changes, except when they remove the few items that might have a flavor other than salty grease.  The kid's menu is honestly more diverse than the adult menu, only because it includes mac-n-cheese and pizza.  Both of which can be ordered with fries, When you find yourself stranded in Waikele looking for something to eat, please remember that you are less than 10 minutes from all sorts of real food.  you do not need to fall into this (grease) trap.

Been to several other Chili's locations in the past but first time here in Waikele. Came here after a good round of golf with some friends who all had worked up an appetite and were very thirsty.  Arriving here at 4:30 ( pre- peak time) made it easy for our group to find seating which is not always the norm at most locations that are usually very busy and have long lines and waiting lists. Upon entering the restaurant we were immediately acknowledged and greeted by several employees and seated at our preference. And this is where we received outstanding and friendly service from our server Kristian. Kristian was attentive to all of our needs and stayed cheerful throughout our stay which at times is no easy task with a bunch of loud, thirsty, and hungry golfers. After making sure that the thirst factor was addressed she immediately took our orders and made helpful suggestions from the menu that assisted in our selections for the feast which included several sampler platters,flatbred and some other delicious sides. It did not take long for our orders to arrive and quiet the noisy starving golfers who were enjoying the refreshing beverages and delicious food. For me the food here was never an issue, what makes any place standout is the service you receive that makes for the total dining experience.  Mahalo Kristian, for the excellent service and making sure our glasses never went empty. And Mahalo Wil (winning fellow golfer) for picking up the tab.

We came here again! This time on a double date with mine and my boyfriend's bestfriends. (Yes we left the keikis with the grandmas! Lol.) It was great! My bestie is kind of a bitch at times and she was definitely on a roll tonight.  But to my surprise the waitress maintain not only her professionalism but her big happy smile too! Thank you Chili's for always being so kind and tolerating my rude friend! Lol. On another note we decided to try the Dr.Pepper Ribs and the mix and match fajita (I think that what it was called) both were out of this world!  I do not like Dr.Pepper at all but I'm so glad my be made me try it! It may be my new favorite!  With the mix and match we got steak and shrimp.  Both were super juicy and full of flavor! Whenever my by asks what I want for dinner I say Chili's!  Lol. If only we could afford to eat out every night!

The lounge underwent a nice remodel. As usual the menu changed again. The food is okay, I like the chips and salsa. The steak combo was surprisingly good. Alaina is the BEST! She has a great attitude and fun personality. She's usually very busy at lunch with her regulars. I enjoy this location, but I tend to sit in the lounge.

Every time my mom and I are in town we stop by this Chili's and we are never let down by the service or food. This time though I was so impressed with the service i had to share. My mom was super tired and we were ready to eat. The restaurant was clean but a little busy. We were greeted right away.  They cleaned a table and sat us right away. Our server Angelica was amazing. She was patient with what my mom was requesting and checked on us every now and then at the right times as sometimes when you are trying to eat it can be intrusive. Angelica's a perfect server.  She was great. We haven't had that kind of service in a while.  By the way the chicken breast on rice with black beans on the lighter menu is a must try.

First time here. I had a great experience thanks to our waitress Shandale S. She was very friendly and she kindly answered my questions about the menu. I ordered the quesadilla explosion salad and my boyfriend ordered the fajitas. It was good!

I come here pretty often even though parking can be challenging. Why? It's decent, affordable food with good service. I'm am particularly fond of Thomas and Alicia. They are fast, smart and kind.  The hubby always gets the sirloin, which normally doesn't disappoint but recently the quality has changed. We actually sent them back because they were cold and raw. Yesterday he ordered it medium and it came medium rare, which is fine. What bothered us was the seasoning was uneven. Half the steak was good and the other half eh.. The California flatbread is crunchy and delish. I always take home 1/2 because it's filling. The burger is affordable and yummy. Many love the chicken crispers but it's a lot of beading an oil for me. Addendum: I rarely have any issues here, which is why I am a regular, I should add if there ever was an issue, the food was comped or we were provided dessert or chips. The staff here make me feel like a valued customer.

I seriously don't recall ever eating here in California. I was headed to Waikele Outlet & wanted to eat lunch before shopping. Decided to try Chili's since i swear i don't remember eating here in Cali. Walked in & was seated right away. The host didn't even say one word. He saw us, grabbed menus, & we just followed him. Kind of rude! Our waiter came to take our orders. He was nothing special.  We ordered the build your own appetizer & chose double of the hamburger sliders & the southwest eggrolls. We also ordered a caesar salad. My daughter ordered chicken strips with warm apples & cinnamon on the side. After a 25 minute wait, we got our food! The hamburger sliders were great! The meat was cooked medium rare. It had grilled onions & bacon. Very tasty! The caesar salad was your typical salad. Nothing special.   Chili's has a very extensive menu! I would eat here again.

location: West Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
review: Fool me once, shame on you. Fool me twice, shame on me. This is the second time that I've ordered something that, when brought to the table, isn't anything as described/pictured. I get that it's just a picture, but when you get something like this, it's just a plain insult. Nicholas, our server was awesome. In fact he was better and more understanding than the Manager.

LOVE the egg rolls & their watermelon lemonade was delicious!! Bacon cheeseburger & smokehouse burger was awesome as well. The smoked quesadillas was okay... I'd rather have a chicken quesadilla from Taco Bell though.  I checked in and claimed my free Chips w/queso but they never brought it to me.. I asked about it again to make sure so they said they would bring it out, but never did. I didn't grumble about it.. Luckily we were full.

I remember why I haven't been back here in over 10 years. The ribs were dry, onion rings burnt and service was average at best. Way overpriced and I didn't like the fact that the payment machine on each table automatically included a 20% tip. Tips are something that is earned by the server. When she gave our onion rings to us she asked "do they look okay?" The chopped parsley that were sprinkled on top of the rings were also old and the rings were really dark brown. We hesitated and said nothing. Once we ate the rings they tasted burnt. See the pictures. My bad for ordering rings and baby back ribs at a Mexican themed restaurant. A lot of better places to eat out there, compared to the way overpriced menu here. Buyer beware!

Braaaaah. We came in on a Thursday afternoon for a late lunch. We had a party of 10, 3 of whom were Senior citizens. From the waiting area, we walked maybe 30 yards to the bar to order drinks while we waited to be seated. I ordered 3 beers for my parents and another 65+ year old friend plus my drink. The douche bag bartender asked me for the IDs of all drinking people. He could clearly see the 3 senior citizens sitting in the waiting area but would not take the order until I walked all IDs over to him. FOR REAL?? I grew up here and now live in LA. Nevah evah have I had this ridiculousness happen. Whack I say...WHACK.

Chili's Grill and Bar in Waikele Pros:  Kid friendly, Fast and friendly service, Tasty food at reasonable prices Cons:  Crowded parking lot, small bathroom My family and I were on the West side today, September 7, and we were starving.  After a long day of soccer and baseball we needed to chow down on some lunch.  We arrived at Chili's at 1pm and had to wait 10 minutes to get a table.  Our nice waiter told us that NFL season is their busiest times so plan on waiting for a table on Sundays.  Good to know.  Lots of room to wait inside and outside so no problem.  Our waiter seemed out of breath because he was working so hard.  But he still kept a smile on and made sure we were always taken care of.  Nice guy! I used our check in and got the free chips and queso.  Highly recommended as the chips are fresh and the queso is something out of the ordinary.  I had the mushroom swiss burger with onion strings.  The burger was moist with lots of flavor from the mushrooms and cheese.  I would say pass on the onion strings and get fries instead.  Onion strings were more oil than anything else.  My wife got the bacon advacado chicken sandwich.  Yum!  My son got the big bites which he loved.  It's 4 bar burgers/sliders that come with chopped up bacon and onions.  If you have young kids they can probably share this.  2 each.  Guaranteed they will love it.  My daughter tried the cheese quesadillas with corn on the cob on the side.  All smiles!  Total price $50. Overall a great restaurant for a family with young kids.  In fact there were a lot of families there today for lunch. Oh and what really impressed me was the unlimited refills on soda and they bring NEW cups every time.  I am a germaphobe so I like the fact that they don't bring my used cup back to the soda machine to refill it.  If they don't bring my cup back then that means they don't bring other customers' cups back as well.  2 thumbs up for that.
great comfort food before we shop till we drop. we here for girls day. love getting the chicken strips. waikele chilis is where it's at. yeah you!!'

Sat at h bar with my husband around 2 pm and our bartender was so awesome! Alaina was so funny and attentive even though she had a full bar and section. She told me about the Yelp check in for a free queso and was just such a pleasure to have as our bartender/server!

My cousin and I dined in for dinner and we always have such a pleasant experience at this location! Even though they were slammin' busy our wait time was only 5mins.  From the moment we were seated, greeted by our waitress, put our order in for drinks, & our meal. I must say we were very pleased! Our waitress was very friendly, & on it w/ replenishing our water & napkins without one of us having to ask. Also, extremely delicious!! Last but not least the icing to the cake, "dessert." Chili's was our go-to spot but the new menu is a turn off. I'm sure their desserts are still great, though.

I was unsure whether or not to post this update, but in the end I felt it might be helpful to others and future customers: I had dinner with a friend at this location this past Saturday, November 3.  We were seated immediately and received more than satisfactory customer service throughout our entire visit.  In the end, I decided to use my debit card to pay for the meal since I did not have enough cash.  My friend and I decided to leave a cash tip, and as I have always done in the past I drew a line thru the tip section/line on the check to signify that I WAS NOT leaving a tip on the card.  I then wrote in the total ($44.55) to be charged on the card and we left the restaurant. Today, Monday, November 5, as I was checking my banking statement online, I discovered the total deducted for Chili's that night was $10 more than the bill.  At first I was upset to discover this, but came to my senses and called the bank, who then instructed me to call Chili's.  I spoke to the manager and he took down all the necessary information so he could research the transaction.  It turns out the server keyed in the wrong amount into their computer (or so the manager says), and therefore my card was charged for $54.55, with $10 being recognized as a tip.  His apology seemed genuine when he said was sorry for the inconvenience, and that the server was not a dishonest person and made a very careless mistake.  He informed me that they could credit back the $10 but it would take at least 2 days since this transaction had to be processed thru their corporate office in California.  He said he would call me to let me know when the transaction had been completed. Bottom Line:  I guess the moral is to double-check your credit card statements and/or banking statements for the correct amount processed.  I'm not terribly upset since the manager was helpful, but I'm very, very disappointed, and will most likely stay away from this location in the future. UPDATE 11/07/12:  $10 was credited back to my account.

Well this place is okay.... What I liked, the taste of the food, the menu items, and the pretty (sorry if this is superficial) and nice servers. Okay I guess I will start off with the good and end with the bad.  First off when I went that evening for dinner I ordered the salmon and baby back ribs combo. Both were very delicious. I enjoyed every single bite. The fish was cooked nicely and the bbq ribs were sweet and tangy the way I like it.  Besides what I had eaten, it was a bit hard to pick what I wanted. They have a nice selection and I will definitely go back to try other stuff.  Now lastly for this section the service, the food came out at a decent time and the server was very nice.  Now for the negative. In this review I place the negative last because this is a chain restaurant so certain negatives are expected. These restaurants have to do really bad in order to lose business. This restaurant is okay... Let me start first with what is not really under their control. This is the Waikele location, so expect parking to be somewhat annoying during the peak hours. The area they are in is small and gets quite congested at times. Since this is partly the fault of the designers of this shopping center I will not count this against them too much. Next let me get to the food. Like I said the food was good, but for the price the servings were way too small. Seriously, the quality was nothing spectacular even though it was very tasty. But then again maybe I'm a bit cheap. But the ribs were barely meaty, it almost seemed like most of the taste was from the bones, and the slice of salmon could have been a bit bigger. The combo was almost $25, but in my opinion it should probably only have been $16 or $17 tops. I'm pretty sure I'm not the only one who feels the same, but oh well let's just see how it goes for them with these prices. Now as I have mentioned I will probably come back. I will definitely choose a different selection and the food will most likely be tasty. Now I leave it to you to decide whether or not you feel like paying a little but extra for nothing special. I do not mean to sound very negative if that is how I came out. But like I said I did enjoy the food and service, but it's just the pricing is debatable. Anyways, I hope you have a pleasant experience if you choose to go.

Chili's has definitely gone downhill, and next time I venture into a chain "American" restaurant, it will be Ruby Tuesdays.  At least they have kick ass crab cakes.

Super love this staff.  The seating girls are awesome. It was a busy Sunday and even the seating at the bar was full and I had missed an opportunity when 2 left and 2 others got to the bar before me.  Well the ladies knew it was only me and made room for me at the bar so I wouldn't have to wait for another opening.  Great attitudes too.  This is what I like about restaurants, employees who like their jobs and like to make customers feel great.

The service here was awesome! Didn't have to wait long for a table and our waitress was great. The only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because of the parking. Parking close to the restaurant you either have to be lucky or wait a while. If you don't mind walking it's better to park in the lot across the way.
This is my 1st time eating the tacos and salad here... the quesidilla explosion salad is amazeballs...
I like the new look..and the staff is alwayz nice!  Great Service The food selection is good! Tonight they have football 7 tvs in the bar area.

My husband and I have been coming here regularly for awhile now and WE LOVE IT! The customer service is amazing. Some of the employees know us by now and we occasionally have small talk. The food is great and I absolutely love the atmosphere. If you sign up with your email you will get sent some really awesome coupons as well. My husband and I have gotten multiple free appetizers and desserts! We will definitely continue coming here! :)

This rating is regarding service provided. Chili's was on point more today than any visit I had! Our server James was very attentive, refilling our drinks, chips, and checking on us throughout our meal. The food was great too!

The service was fast and they were very nice.  Although the place was packed our server stopped by each table and made sure things were ok. If that annoys you then idk I personally like it because it shows they care about my needs in their facility and want me to enjoy my stay. I'd definitely eat there again :)

#latepost me and my girlfriend came to this location various times in the past years. and i still love this place since my first date with my girlfriend  we were welcomed as soon as we came in. There was no wait, and was seated right away. It was my girlfriend and I they gave us a booth which I love! We were asked if we wanted drinks as we sat and were checked on a lot along with many water refills without us having to ask. To start off we got the appetizer trio with the egg rolls, boneless buffalo wings, and onion rings and it was brought fresh and hot to our table within 5-10 minutes. We ordered the chicken crisp, side mac and cheese, extra honey mustard sauce, and the shrimp and steak fajita. All of our food came out by the time we were done with our appetizers which was excellent! No wait at all at this visit but which should be expected since they were not busy. We ordered our dessert, our favorite the chocolate molten lava cake, off the kiosk and it came within 5 minutes as well. Everything was tasty, delicious, and fresh with no complaints. I loved how our waitress and the staff always came to check on us and could do a little small talk as we enjoyed a peaceful lunch. A chili s I've always returned to.

The food was excellently prepared and they helped us get it out quicker because we had a flight which was great. Staff is really helpful and kind. Atmosphere is real nice and friendly. Thoroughly enjoyed my time and meal here. Would recommend.

I ordered the quesadilla explosion salad and a side order of the tortilla chips w/ salsa. You can't go wrong with the tortilla chips.  The service is consistently good, and the staff always check to make sure you have enough to drink, etc.  The restaurant is always clean.   There's lots of parking by McDonald's or across by Lowe's. If you sign up online with Chilli's, you can get all kinds of offers/specials sent to you.

My wife and I like to go to our local Chili's every month or two for a decent (a relative term, since we live in Hawaii) Tex-Mex dinner four or five blocks from our house.  No great expectations, we know what to expect with Chili's, but then...maybe not.   For starters, the menu has changed.  Where's my country fried steak???  That's been my old Chili's standby for the last 30 years.  You don't just drop something like that without letting customers know.  But that's not what this review is about. Rather, I have now been propelled into the DIY restaurant check era, whether I wanted to or not.  Our last visit was before Christmas.  Since then our local Chili's has installed a unique interactive video device called the "Ziosk."  I'm told this is common on the US Mainland, but it's new to us in Hawaii.  The host that seated us gave us a quick user demonstration/operational checkride on how we could reorder our bar drinks that we didn't order to start with, order dessert before we even met our server, get calorie information on menu items (if we were worried about calories we wouldn't be at Chili's), pay our bill including tip, and best of all, play video games while waiting or eating ($1.99 each).  I noticed there's an e-mail function also...don't even want to imagine how that worked.   Excuse me, but if I want all that meal-time video I'll go to my son's house for dinner, which would be delightful since he lives in Portland OR and has a wonderful wife. So we completed our meals, ordered a piece of cheesecake to take home, and were presented with an inventory of our orders with cost (as opposed to the traditional meal check).  Our server would happily take cash, but if we wanted to use a credit card...then we have to deal with Mr Ziosk.  Now check out the photo...can you see all the fingerprints on the Ziosk, not to mention a couple unidentifiable organic substances permanently attached to the screen?  I am relatively okay with the DNA I currently have, don't need anyone else's, thank you.  I have to say I was eager to get home and wash my hands once that Ziosk transaction was complete. About that transaction...once you're handed a check, that white-light area at the top center of the screen turns bright red.  After you pay it turns green...a color-coded, guilt-driven collection enforcement system!  If we got up and left before paying it probably would have set off sirens, red and blue flashing lights, and laser fire across the aisle.  But we did pay, and then it thoughtfully suggested a 20% tip which I felt duty-bound to pay, since we did have a nice server as usual.  You can slide the on-screen tip scale left and right for smaller or larger percentages, but that would require additional contact with that screen. As it is, I'm still getting used to sliding my credit cards in grocery and department store card readers, gas pumps, et al, so this didn't have a huge comfort factor for me.  Except...pretty soon we're eligible for a smart phone upgrade and an iPhone 6 is definitely in our future.  Apple Pay...just touch that screen...someday.  Okay, that's a leap I can make.  Like paying for Starbucks with my current iPhone 5 (we are so-o 2013) by scanning my secret gold card barcode...way cool.  I wouldn't go to Starbucks even a fraction of the times I do now if I couldn't pay with my iPhone!  So maybe the next time we go back to Chili's we can just hold our iPhone 6 on Mr Ziosk and the two can make nice without actually touching that screen.  It's a step in the right direction, I guess. Oh, and the food at Chili's was great as usual, and so were the staff.  Kicking and screaming into the 21st century!

For checking in and getting free queso and chips is a great offer!!!!! Always have good service. Food is good and drinks are yummy. Have a lot of girls' nights here. It's a great place for laughs and food

Check in on yelp and ask your waitress for complimentary chips and queso. That was probably the best part of my meal! Lol. Anyway, stopped over for lunch on a Saturday around 2pm. We had the triple dipper and a lunch combo. Food was good. The waitress had a bit of an attitude but it's okay. The margaritas and appetizers make up for it.
The best Presidente....waikele has the best bartendars Love the triple dipper and flat bread

TERRIBLE SERVICE!!!! Appetizers took 15minutes! When we finally got it, order was wrong! We were out of drinks, SHE WAS OUT OF SIGHT/did not bother to check on the table. Took ANOTHER 20 minutes to get our food. By then we just lost our appetite!

The WORST Chili's  experience ever!! Sunday morning football : wait staff 2, hostess 0, food order took 15mins a +, drink refills 0 - went to McDonald's for a drink and finally as much as I did not want to TIP - clearly it was not the young ladies fault.  Chili's Management: you truly dropped the ball on this one.

We arrived at about 4:30pm for an early dinner. Our party of 7 was handled without issue. All in all the Waikele Chili's took care of business.  I had the chicken crispers and a Budweiser bottle. The rest of our party ordered chips and queso, tortilla soup,  burgers, quesadillas and chicken soft tacos. No major complaints but we find the Kahala Chili's more enjoyable.

My husband and I had lunch there last week, and while the food was great as always our server was not. She needs a little lesson on boundaries. For one, she touched my hair because I had something in it.. You don't grab a strangers hair, you ask first or let them know there's something in it! I was shocked- didn't know how to react! Then when we were using the app to pay when leaving she stood right at our table with no shame staring at the screen until we chose the tip we were going to give her and then walked away. It was crazy! I don't know what was wrong with her, She might have been trying to be friendly but she made us super uncomfortable. I was so angry and I'm usually not a complainer but that was just not okay. We normally go to the one in kapolei as its closer, and after this awkward incident we will stick to going there instead of waikele/Waipahu.
Service is always great, the servers are pleasant & fun, food is good! Only in Waikele!

Service was awesome, our server was NICK !  Didn't have to wait long to be seated at my table, very nice booths. Didn't wait long for my food. But  the Food quality wasn't  what I expected, the taste was just one step higher then Taco Bell. Wasn't bad but wasn't good.

Chili's is a great place to get together with friends and family in a casual environment. The service is great here and the food tasty! I usually get the quesadillas which (any of them) are filling and satisfying! This time though I stuck with the chips and salsa (refills free-great appetizer/snack) and ordered the Resse's Volcano Cake. (Idk if that's what it's really called but that's what it looked like!)  SO delicious and yummy...hurry and try it because it's a special item for now!

I have always had a mixed bag with servers there. The last experience I had was the absolute worst. I took my son there for his birthday, and the food came out extremely slowly. A couple of orders were wrong and had to be returned. Then, the server came out with a plate of food spilling over. Something fell on the floor, and more of the food was about to do that. The server then pushes the food back onto her plate with her bare finger. I told her to get a new order and asked for her manager.  The food is okay, especially the chicken. I will never eat at that location again, though.  The only worse location was the one at Pearlridge. My family and I waited 30 minutes after being seated, never being given water or a menu. We just got up and left.

Ah, first time at Chili's and it wasn't what I had hoped for. The wait felt like a long time, especially since smaller parties were being seated quicker than larger parties. What we've been saying was combine tables. Our waitress was Janine, the best we could ask for! Friendly and already knew when the guys I was with wanted another round. They don't have Irish car bombs though! Initially I was going to order the quesadilla, but the ribs caught my eye right after. I guess I should've ordered that instead! As everyone else's food started coming out, I was eventually the only one without food in front of them. Janine noticed and checked up with the kitchen. When my food finally arrived, I noticed my fries were hot but my ribs COLD:  . I tried eating one rib, and it was dissatisfying! I even poked at the next rib where there was meat and damn, COLD. Told everyone at our table and had Janine take it back when she came by again. When I got my ribs back again, it was the SAME half slab but reheated with BBQ sauce. I tried a piece, and was totally over it. It was comped of course. But I guess if I wanted ribs I should've gone to Tony Roma's. After that, ordered dessert. I really wanted to try the cake but ordered the Brownie Sundae instead:  . Hot brownie and cold ice cream, can't mess that up right? Before ordering dessert, we felt rush when Janine thought we were ready to go, since she came with our check after someone asked for a box. Towards the end, they provided us a bag of chips and salsa. After this experience, it will be a long time before I visit Chili's again.

The workers here are so friendly and the food tastes great! I recommend this place for those of you who are looking for a great steakhouse with good drinks! However, the burgers are pretty bland because there are no sauces in them (idk if it's just the one I ordered) but overall, the service is GREAT & food (except burgers) are great as well.
Our server Kristin aka K10 was super awesome. Great customer service and lots of fun and laughs. She made it a great experience for us

we came just for deserts. the wait wasn't too long..less than 5 mins. we came in on a Saturday at 9ish. our server was very accommodating and tried to met all our needs. will definitely come again. the cinnamon rolls with ice cream dessert is a must if you have a extra sweet tooth.

Service was ok.  Had to send back our first appetizer order and the replacement took a really long time to come out.  First dish we ordered was the Skillet Queso which is described as white cheese dip with seasoned beef.   It was brown, full of beans, no beef and tasted exactly like a not-so-great bean dip.   Replacement was the spinach Queso and that was much better.   But like I said, it was probably 15 minutes for that dish to come out.

We showed up just after the lunch rush. Briskly seated and waited on by an attentive and polite waitress. Longish wait for the food was reasonable since the meat was ordered well done. Everybody enjoyed their food. Excellent experience. Restrooms were clean to boot.

Staff is really, really awesome! The wait time is never too bad. The food, however, is pretty hit or miss. I've never had a problem with appetizers but sometimes my entree will be a little cold. Overall pretty good place for dinner or a date!

Chili's just never lets me down!  This is my mom, sister and I's favorite restaurant in Hawaii. The menu seem price-y. It can get expensive, but it's totally up to the person who orders. ;) I personally love their Honey Chipotle Chicken Crispers!! Its sauce is the right kind of sweet and spicy that I'm looking for. Plus, it is one of the choices in their marvelous Tripple Dipper Appetizer, which I always get with their really tasty spinach and artichoke dip! I would ask for fresh Nachos, without salt, as it brings out more of the flavor of the dip, for the salt doesn't overpower everything else. Speaking of, we had a really awesome server at Waikele, shout out to Jennay! Mahalo for your service :) Their choices varies from burgers to salads, steaks and seafood. Moreover, the beverages they offer completely compliments their meal!! Total YUM! Their blackberry ice tea is my preferred beverage- that you can ask to adjust the sweetness of- more or less syrup. ;) Not to mention their desserts! We always get the molten chocolate cake with the hard-cover chocolate (which is the ice cream being shelled by chocolate goodness) that is oozing with caramel and chocolate!  And! To those who counts their calories, Chili's labels the calorie count for each meal. They also serve light portions and other healthier options. So I salute thee for considering those who are on this particular way-to-go diet. :)  Of course there is the bar side and TV everywhere.  I am just a Chili's girl, every time I go to Chili's I love the place more, whichever locations is just as epic!

Came here last night because the wait at Kapolei's one was 30-45 minutes and we couldn't wait any longer. Called in to be put on the wait list at waikele's Chili's with a party of nine plus a high chair. Our server was Becky, she was awesome. Despite the big party, she gave us one of the best services I ever had. She took our order in a timely manner and checked up us on a few times. Even made small talk with us. She even placed our food/drinks away from my child because she noticed that he was a grabber. Lol. And the rest of the team at Chili's were great as well. The host let us know that they were waiting for a clear table for us and the expeditors or the two who helped brought out the food was patient with us. Our food was brought out all at the same time and our server never did keep us waiting. Would definitely come back again whenever we are craving for Chili's.
Marginal food and weak drinks at a price that does not reflect what you get.  Go for a local place for food and drink, unless you like the atmosphere of the restaurant.  But you pay for it...

The waitress at the bar was unfriendly and awkward.  My drink had blended up plastic in it, which I didn't notice until half way through it.  I swallowed some of it and could feel it in my throat.  When I brought it to her attention she took my drink and walked to the back.  When she came back her response was that she didn't know what it was and that she checked everything and can't figure out what it was.  She offered no apology and no way to make amends.  She just stood there, awkwardly.  I had to tell her to take it off my bill. Horrible service.  My drink was alright until I drank plastic.   Food was normal.

Our main server (Kerri if I'm not mistaken) did not check up on us once. She mainly just brought us water, dropped off food, and dropped off check, that's about it. She did not ask us how everything was. She walked by a couple of times, avoiding us. Did not refill water. Did not ask if we wanted dessert. She was not smiling.  Thank god the manager was there to serve us. I wish I have gotten her name. She was super friendly, and very personable. Even though it was busy, she still made time to check up on us. She got me more potato skin because she felt the ones I got weren't cooked properly (big plus for that). She also apologized for not checking up on us as much as she wanted to. I asked if the tip would go to her because obviously she was paying more attention to us than the other girl, but she couldn't take it. If the other server had paid more attention to us, trust me, she would have gotten a really good tip because I am a server as well, she just didn't deserve a good tip. Maybe next time!  Oh yeah, food was good as well.
Great food and friends. Always go there to watch NFL. They have the best salsa. I also like their chips and chicken. Great prices.

Haven't been here in awhile but was shocked to see a differently new menu.  I was craving some other stuff on their old menu but just decided to try some of their new ones.  I had the sizzling fajita platter and It was pretty good.  Drinks there are always good. Also there homemade chip and salsa was a hit with my family.  I guess I'll come back and try out the rest of menu.

Ordered take out. They said it would be ready in 15 minutes. It was not. Took over half and hour before I got my take out.  Alex the bartender offered me water and brought out chips and salsa. He checked on my order every two minutes. I never ever got served water while I was waiting for my phone order. Next time I dine there I won't get a table but I am going to sit at the bar with Alex.

THU, 7-16-15 at about 5:15 pm AWESOME, AWESOME, AWESOME! Our server THOMAS was absolutely outstanding! He was fun, polite and had a great sense of humor. Thomas is a definite asset to Chili's Grill & Bar. He really made our dinner extra special. If more people in the customer service industry were like Thomas, businesses would have lines of people waiting to get in and profits would skyrocket.  The food was excellent as well. Freshly prepared, proper serving temperature and very yummy. Triple Dipper (Big Mouth  Bites, Original Chicken Crispers, Southwestern Eggrolls), Fresh Mex Pairings (Green Chile Chicken Enchilada & Sour Cream Chicken Enchilada), Classic Turkey Toasted Sandwich, cheesecake and Molten Chocolate Cake...all super delicious! Go to Chili's in Waikele and ask for Thomas as your server. Great service, great food! Aloha.

This place is GOOD. The Margharita Flat Bread is to die for. Their molten lava chocolate cake is sinfully delicious. They have terrific hamburgers if you're not into spicy Tex-Mex. Everything is good. Sometimes the service is a bit slow. We usually go early and the service is excellent. It is a warm place, a bit noisy if you're next to a rowdy group, but that adds to the fun.
Good friendly kid and family atmosphere. The food is good too. Came in on an email coupon.

I don't know why my experiences with Chili's always ends up with overly salted food. One of our friends was being sent TAD (temporary assigned duty) to the Middle East and someone made the decision to meet here since it was more convenient for everyone. I wasn't too thrilled but oh well.  There probably isn't much I can say about Chili's that hasn't already been said. Chain restaurant, usually crowded especially on the weekends. Reservations are recommended and even with reservations you might have a bit of a wait. Tends to get noisy and the AC is on full blast so bring a light jacket if you are like me and tend to get cold with AC.  On this night I ordered the Chicken Fried Steak on the suggestion of a friend who claimed it was "really good" and said that's all he orders when he eats at any Chili's. Since he seemed to be the authority on Chili's cuisine (he and his wife apparently go every weekend) I decided to take the plunge and go for it. BIG MISTAKE. I should've stayed in my safety zone and ordered a burger.  My plate looked like a plate of barf, there was chunky white gravy everywhere and it was super salty. At first I thought it was the gravy so I ate around the gravy but the Chicken Fried Steak was still salty and so were the mash potatoes. I hardly touched my food and the friend who suggested it also said it was too salty and only ate half of his. When the waitress came to clear the table she asked if I wanted to box my food but I told her it was too salty. She did offer to have something else made but I declined.  The pros - friendly and attentive service & they make a pretty darn good beer-garita. For me, Chili's certainly isn't on the top my list of places that I have to eat at. Food is meh. If I do end up at a Chili's again, will stick to a burger.

Very slow service.. waited over 40 mins for food.. we ordered soup n salad so it should not have taken this long.. watched other tables around us get soup n salad and they had  ordered after us.. now we are waiting for refills on our salads.. been here almost 2hrs.. not happy..

We ate a late lunch at Chilis this past Saturday when the weather was really bad. Our experience at Chilis made the day much brighter! We were seated pretty quickly and was then served by Colton T. He was awesome! He provided great customer service in all areas of a great dining experience. He was welcoming with a great attitude. He was very personable and seemed genuine in his interactions with us. His recommendations were spot on and always checked in on us, making us feel comfortable. He answered all our menu questions and accommodated us on food choices. He even had candid conversations with our children. And we weren't the only ones, his service was the same for the customers in the booths next to us! Mahalo, Colton!

Our visit was superb. The hostess greeted us with the warmest smile and our waiter was super friendly and polite. The did get my order wrong however they corrected it in a timely manner and was very polite about it. Our total experience was great and we were in and out of there in under an hour. Fast friendly service I loved it. Definitely going back there again.

I ate lunch here the food was okay i had the fajita skillet i liked the chicken the steak ehh. Not too much flavor and a little tough.  Our server was nice and very efficient.  Decore is the same at all chilis.  So overall good quick service for lunch above average food and as for prices ehh..  its a chain and wer in hawaii....

Lunch specials are the perfect size. I really appreciate restaurants like Chili's Grill and Bar as I can't "eat" per say a regular sized adult meal. In addition to loving the smaller portions service was superior at this location. Our waiter was very attentive, drinks were refilled in a timely manner along with paying attention to special order.

Chilis.  They are known for their appetizers and baby back ribs. Recently, online, my wife and I learned they have a happy hour.  I'm excited about good bourbon and something to "snack" on while relaxing celebrating our latest project completion.   My wife had just completed a massive undertaking on an Excel spreadsheet she created from scratch and entering data... all done ahead of schedule.  To brag, she put in 71 hours last week.  That qualifies as an undertaking of monster mental complexity deserving of a treat on the town. I digress.  We decided on Chili's.  It's close and although a chain restaurant, can't be all that bad or they wouldn't be a chain, right?   Well... We arrived at 3pm on a Friday.  After a courteous staff allowed us to wait for a table or booth at the "bar area" (only location of happy hour) we were seated with only a 10 minute wait.  Enough time to review the menu and enjoy the scenery.  Tacky as it may be, it still is something fun to see. We were seated and the table was wiped, though sticky all the same.  We had it wiped again, most likely with the same original cloth, though no proof of that, so it's only an opinion. You know you're in for a "Denny's" or "Red Lobster" type place when they show photos of the food on laminated menus.  That's ok, I suppose.  Again, I didn't expect Morton's or Ruth's Chris Steak House.  Our waiter was on the slow side.  Sure there was a full bar area, though with the 3 wait staff, I would expect a "little" priority in service.  Now, I had water, so I was o.k. for a beverage while I awaited my double Jim Beam. Here's the depressing note... If you are a man (or woman) who enjoys a drink, we know a "double neat" means a glass nearly half full (at an absolute minimum).  Not here.   The bartender measures each pour, as I observed, precisely.  She could have been a scientist making a solution of explosives with the exactitude in her pours.   My double came ($12) and it was no more than a single ANYWHERE ELSE on Island.  I assumed it was a mistake or oversight and poured a single.  I had fried cheese (deliciously precisely made, though could have used a lot more sauce.)  No complaint on the food.  Very delicious snacks. I ordered another double bourbon neat.  This time I watched and watched as the waiter never gave her the order.  He came to apologize and my scientifically measured drink was poured. I had to ask the waiter, "Why are the drinks being so poorly made?"  He said, "That's the way she is".  I see, I said.  She is allowed freedom to screw patrons.  A beer would have been the way to go, in retrospect. So, here's my advice:   Enjoy the appetizers.  They are fun and affordable.  Two "$$" signs on prices.  Stay away from the hard liquor. Four "$$$$" on their price and quantity.  I paid TWENTY FOUR ($24) for two exact measures of bourbon twice.  I could buy a NEW, FULL bottle of their bourbon of choice, Jim Bean (white label), for $11 at the local grocery store (Times), which I do. The staff are young and therefore unknowledgeable of "where to go" and "what to do" in the area.  I can blame that on youth.   Please, if you're looking for a BEER Happy Hour, then this is the place to go.  If you want a beverage or liquor, go somewhere else.  You will pay an OUTRAGOUS fee for thimbles of drink. Pay head to these words of wisdom.  Enjoy your Happy Hour.  Oh, if I recall, it begins early, somewhere around 2pm.  Want an early beer, go here. Cheers mate!

By far my favorite location on the island. Great staff and good food make for an awesome night anytime I come here. No matter what I get it always tastes great. I do love the Cajun pasta and the lava cake the best.
Try the quesadilla explosion salad and a side of spinach it was so amazing. Our waiter was very nice and so was every one else. I hardly come here but I should more often. Excellent food

Usually I'm fine with Chili's but have to vent about my latest trip to the Waikele Chili's. I always get emails from Chili's with coupon deals and have never had any problems redeeming them before. On August 15, I got an email from Chili's that said "Triple Dipper only $9.99 for a limited time"  Since my friends and I always eat the Triple Dipper this was a GREAT deal.  So after work on August 16, we went to the Waikele Chili's. We were given the menu with their current specials & it said that the Tripler Dipper was $12.99 for a limited time. We asked our server about the $9.99 email & she said that people have been asking about the $9.99 prices all day, but that they do not participate in that offer.  We even showed her the email and said that NO WHERE on the email did it say, participating locations only (or something similar to that).   She said that they are a franchise and so they don't participate.  She said that only the Waikiki location was participating in that offer.  We were irked, but didn't push it any further.  We ordered 4 of the Triple Dippers and then when we got our bills, we were charged $13.99 each. When we asked about the incorrect price, she told us that $13.99 was the price. We said why does your menu say $12.99? She said that it was ringing up as $13.99 and she didn't think there was any specials going on, but she would check with her manager. She came back & said that there was a special and it was $12.99 and that she would change our checks. She said she just thought that the menu was wrong. H E L L O !! The food was yummy as always and our server was nice & attentive to our needs (refilling drinks, etc).  Just think she should be aware of the current specials.  However I'm still irked about the false advertising so I rated this experience low :-(

Updating my previous review. Ordered takeout here tonight and it was completely amazing. Got in, got out, very quickly. The waitress who gave us our order was very sweet, and when we got home the food was very good. Everything was correct and tasted great. I can't wait to come back here, good service good food.

Absolutely love the Spicy Shrimp Tacos....so Onolicious! Came by recently for a holiday dinner and Alex was our server and he was Awesome! Also came by for a quick pupu the other day and Josiah assisted us. I live nearby and come in every now and then and from my experience I feel the best servers are Alex & Josiah. They are so friendly, professional & made us feel welcomed.

The staff here are very friendly. It can get pretty noisy in here because the bar is right in the middle and screaming sports fans get very excited especially juiced with alcohol. Chilli's recently changed their menu 2 months ago. They added a lot of new items, and their new menu looks good. I always order the triple dipper and they got rid of the spinach dip and the loaded potato skins which were really good. Prices are not bad for this new menu.

I came to eat dinner on 24 July with my 2 foreign exchange students to give them the opportunity to experience an American restaurant.  They wanted to break their $100 note and decided to to walk up to a server, who wasn't our own, to break their bill.  As it was their first time, they did not know that our server would be able to do this for them.  My table mates and I watched from a short distance as our foreign exchange students made their inquiry.  Perhaps due to their thick foreign accents, the server might have not understood their request.  I heard her say to them, "you can do it at your table."  She seemed a bit frustrated and walked down the aisle briskly calling out quite loudly for our sever.  I found that yelling for a co-worker while walking down the aisles to be out of the ordinary because it called attention to herself.   I asked my 2 students what happened and they mentioned that the other server shouted at them, but they didn't understand what she was saying.  Unfortunately, speaking progressively louder and quicker does not increase the comprehension of the listener, particularly if the language we use, which is English, is not their primary language.   I mention this because Chili's in Waikele, Hawaii is a location with much foreign customers, many of whom have very limited English speaking skills.  I expect that servers at this Chili's to have a bit more courtesy and patience.  Just because a customer does not speak English does not mean that they are dumb, stupid, or deaf.  Perhaps management needs to give more inter-cultural sensitivity training to the staff members of Chili's in Waikele.

I always find it hard to rate chain restaurants. For the most part the food is generally consistent as is the service. Sometimes the servers (and restaurant in general) have a bad day and I find it really hard to give a restaurant a poor rating based on an "off" day. This rating is an average of a number of visits.  Generally staff is pretty friendly and the service is usually on point. I have never been here when an item was not available. The restaurant is usually pretty clean as is the bathroom. One thing I really like about this location is the fact that they tend to honor mainland deals more than the other Chili's (namely Kapolei). I will not even start my rant about businesses that do not honor deals in Hawaii. Overall, this is a pretty decent chili's. There are not a whole lot of eating options in the Waikele area so if you are going to dine while bargain hunting, I recommend that you do it here!

There was a long blonde hair in my sister's burrito.  She found it half-way throughout eating it.  GROSS GROSS GROSS.  She wanted to barf.  The manager comped her meal and gave us a free dessert (so that bumped this review up to 2 start).  Still soooo GROSS GROSS GROSS, esp after eating it.  I know these things happen sometimes, but it's forever in our memory.  Think I'll boycott Chili's for awhile.

I would love to post the video of the first "Tableside" Guacamole on our last visit. But there doesn't seem to be a place to do that. Our waitress was Courtney. She was so much fun! For some reason we were talking about On the Border and how they make fresh "tableside" guacamole (in Texas...my fav place to go when I go visit my daughter Courtney....wow same name...lol). Courtney, our waitress, said that Chili's was going to start making their own tableside as well and so I got her to make the FIRST Waipahu Chili's "Tableside" Guac at our table. I do have a very cute video of her making it. She made the whole experience fun!!! Let me know how I can post it on here and we can all watch Courtney make her first fresh guac!!! Thanks for the great food and the great service!!! Donna

Got there around 100 pm with my girls.Checked in and the host said it was a 20 min wait.About 8 families came in after us and got seated before us.It was about 140 pm and I realized that we still haven't been called to be seated.Went up to check and the host said she called us at 118?? Umm, how is that possible we was seating right inside in front of you and did not hear any staff call my name! Girl in front was also very sassy when she was telling us she called my name!
Overpriced bar food....... service was bad, waiter never came back to check on us again.  I'm not coming back again.

Real Rating: 3.5 stars. First off, NO MORE PARADISE PIE!?!?! WTF CHILI'S!? You heard me right, the paradise pie is no longer offered. Replaced by some pan-cooked cookie with ice cream. Decent alternative, but no where near a worthy replacement. Moving on, for this specific location: I've been here dozens of times over the past decade or so. It's affordable, staff has generally been great, and the wait time has been fairly reasonable as well. Food is what you pay for, and portions aren't undersized. I feel its a very worth family-restaurant. Problems with this location is that it gets extremely packed during any rush time. I would say venture to Kapolei or the lesser visited Pearlridge if you must dine at Chili's. For Waikele, just park across the "street" and not waste any time searching for parking in the lot with Chili's/McD's/Genki.
My server was friendly.  The timing of the food was spot on because we had pupus. When I got my main course it looked like and tastes like it was under a warmer for a while.

Restaurant has a revamped menu with new choices. Had the guacamole burger with turkey patty (just like the pic in the menu). It was really tasty. Patty was juicy and not burned. Sweet potato fries were good too.

UGH!  Another chain restaurant visit, but we were becoming tired and cranky running in and out of the outlets during the mauka showers (mauka showers meaning that when we step outside, it starts raining, but when we enter a store it stops raining - Mother nature has a sense of humor).  Looking around, McDs and a common fried chicken place are immediately off the list.  There's a promising sushi place, but since I feel that consuming raw fish is tempting fate less that 8 hours before a transoceanic flight, that was dismissed.  Ok, Chili's is there, so we go... The lunch special that catches my eyes is the unlimited soup and salad.  Sounds intriguing, but I look over the menu again just to make sure.  Hey, what do ya know, Chilis serves chili!  Thats interesting, and they serve it "local style".  Sounds interesting, the chili and sticky rice combination, so I go for it as an add on to the soup and salad special.  It doesnt disappoint, but at the same time it doesnt win me totally over.  The salad was fresh out of a bag, but without the plastic bag taste and one BIG patter of chips and salsa, which were really tasty in my opinion. As for lunch on the run is concerned, its not a bad place to stop and dry out.
fuck this place. After eating their food, their food gave me diarrhea. Avoid it like the plague.

Over priced for what you get.  The menu doesn't describe the food very well.  I ordered enchiladas and I asked if there were no onions, the waiter said there are not... indeed there were, so it took a whole lot of picking around to be able to eat.  My son ordered chicken quesadillas and my enchiladas were also supposed to be chicken, but they both came cheese only with no chicken. The service was pretty slow.  Overall mediocre, bleh.

So what can I really say about this restaurant that makes it a four star? I mean, it's hard to rate Chili's anything below a three anyways since they have such good food, and from my experience thus far, great service, at every restaurant I've been to. I think the restaurant in Mililani is much nicer with a great waiting area outside and just somehow a nicer ambience inside.  But this place deserves four stars because I've always had excellent service, no problem with parking and the food always came out right. Never had a bad or irritable time with anything. Temperature's about right too which matters a lot in my book. Very smooth... in and out... but I must say... I have no clue how this place is when it's super packed because I've never been here when it's really packed. I think I've been here overall of 8 times, so maybe it's the less busier Chilis?  Of course the food is great, but not much different from other Chili's food. My food always comes out fresh and sizzling/hot/cold. So not problem with that. And I don't think I've ever had to wait.... Why not 5 stars? Ehhh... it's not perfect... it could be better. The bathroom's all the way on the right side in the back... kind of sucks for those all the way on the left side... and it's not very "chill" near the bar area since the restaurant entrance just seems so RIGHT THERE. Wish the outside didn't seem so in the middle of the parking lot in the middle of traffic and everything... weird.

Amazing service and great lunch combos for $10.99! Come between 11am-4pm Mon-Fri for lunch combos. Felicia was an awesome server. Always checked up on us and refilled our waters on time. New manager Gladys greeted is with a fabulous welcoming smile. Definitely made our day and will come back again! Thank you Felicia & Gladys!
Service here is always great and love the food! Best customer service of any Chili's on the island.

Came in about 5pm on a Friday night. I checked in with yelp & got the free queso & chips. Saved about $7. Score! I always order the grilled chicken sandwich with sweet potato fries & honey mustard on the side. It's always delicious & today was no different. I must give props to awesome service. Customer service is pretty hard to find nowadays. I didn't get her name but our waitress was very cheery, professional, and pleasant.

If you're looking for an excellent south of the border food, then this is not a place for you. The food was very mediocre at best. Thank God there was salt and pepper on the table because food was very bland. It used to be a decent restaurant chain but the quality of service and food has gone down the drain. Wait time was very long and the wait staff that we had barely came to our table. We waited at least half an hour for our meal and the food was already cold by the time it got to us. If it wasn't for a command function i surely would not have chosen to come here.

this was my first time here at this chili's location with my fam bam!  we came in around 1pm and we waited less than 10 mins for a table. sucked.. they ran out of high chairs!! good thing my nephew was asleep in the stroller..  the waitress took like ten minutes to come to us.. we made it in time for the lunch menu. it's from 11-4 and they serve you a salad or soup.. with some French fries and half of a sandwich.. it might not seem to filling.. but it really is. after the nacho chips and salsa dip they give you.. it's filling. the nacho chips are light and thin.. extra crispy. best when they are fresh out the oven onto your table.  I got a house salad with avocado ranch dressing.. yummy!! and I ordered the turkey avocado sandwich. it was so so good! the French fries had some seasoning on them that made it taste delicious.  my parents split a two entree meal that was less than $20 and they enjoyed it! the got steak with fajitas I believe.. the fajitas were marinated Ina. delicious sauce.. very very flavorful.  our waitress was very friendly and came by often to refill our waters and drinks. at the end of our meal she even gave us a bag of chips and a side of salsa to take home with  us!! super awesome!  back to that second high chair.. my daughter had hers.. after my nephew woke up.. there was still no high chair available :/ boo. no worries though.. he was still in his sleepy daze and by the time my daughter was fed up with it.. we just switched them.  they have tv's! they were playing basketball and sports center :D sucky part.. there was no sound to the tv nor sub titles. but they had some really awesome lunch time music!  they have a baby changing table in the restroom! yay!  parking kinda sucks.. cause they share it with McDonald's and the surround genki sushi.. so we parked across the street where the extended sports authoriy I would def come here with my fam! the atmosphere food and service were awesome!

Always delicious.  We go about once a month and try different dishes.  Never been disappointed. Sometimes we just have appetizers and drinks and its excellent.  Good atmosphere too.  Sometimes really crowded and you have to wait awhile.  Sign up for their email and you get discounts and FREE appetizer or dessert coupons!!!!

I usually LOVE chili's, but this past trip was not the best... I ordered the triple dipper with chicken crispers, big mouth bites, and southwest eggrolls.  The crispers were so oily I could not finish one and the honey mustard sauce was separated...I couldn't even look at it.  The eggrolls and big mouth bites were delicious though.  My friend got the quesadilla explosion salad which is usually HUGE, but it came on a small plate...for the SAME price...disappointing to say the least.

Worst service ever. But what can you really expect, it's chilli's? Or was I wrong in thinking we would get at least decent service at a chain restaurant. I thought they would at least have standards. The server was completely unfamiliar with any of the alcoholic drinks on the menu. Who doesn't know what's in a sangria? It was awful. When we wanted to pay the bill, the server messed up one of our checks. Instead of apologizing, she snatched our credit cards and receipts and left us not knowing what was going on. After 20 minutes we went to the kitchen to find out what was going on. With 5 servers plus the manager huddled behind the POS system, they still couldn't figure out how to fix the checks. The manager completely threw his employee under the bus and still didn't even apologize for the inconvenience. Needless to say, I'm surprised their employees aren't trained better because chilli's is such a big chain restaurant and I would think they're really corporate and have standards. Oh well, shitty food, shitty service.

I had the Buffalo Chicken Ranch sandwich, which was really good. My wife had the chicken crispers which was good the only problem we had was that one of the chicken strips was just a bit under done,  but they docked my wife's meal.  Overall the service was amazing considering we came at the busy part of lunch.
Usual good food, we just come for the triple dipper combo...and the cookie skillit nomz
We've come here multiple times and have always enjoyed the service and food! Today has been great, our waitress has treated us with kindness and drinks were never low! Lunch food was awesome!!

Chili's for me, is one of those places that is not super duper great but not junk. It's somewhere right in between.  The ambiance is fun. A good place to just kick back and relax with your friends. For you drinkers...they have a wide selection of alcoholic drinks and I hear the margaritas are good.  The best thing I like about chili's is the chicken enchilada soup. It is so delicious!!! I love it! Other than that, I normally get the same things...either the honey chipotle chicken crispers with fries and corn (also delicious, and I'm talking about the corn), or the triple dipper (honey chipotle chicken crispers, southwest egg rolls, and the mini burgers).  We recently we to lunch at this Chili's and I ordered the triple dipper. Our server was awesome. He was nice, attentive and friendly. I can't remember his name but he was awesome! Good job...guy! My meal plus tip came out to $18, which wasn't bad because I had leftovers that I ate later.  Just a word of caution, if you go on the weekend...it gets crowded.

1 star for the constant refills of water.  Thanks.  Anyways, my boyfriend ordered the steak fajitas. Hes gotten it before but this time he didn't want tortillas. He wanted 2 things different. Rice, so that's what he ordered and no bell peppers- He ordered extra onions to make up for no bell peppers. They made him pay for his rice seperately and he paid for the extra onions seperately...okaaay Thing is he paid the main price for the fajitas. So he paid $20 just for minimal flank steak and some of the the onions on his plate. It wasnt much. They didnt even give him any of the sides. Salsa,guacamole,fiesta corn etc. No tortillas but he still paid for all of that and his sides seperately.  Hmmm...Then theres my food, i had the cajun pasta. There was something 100% wrong with my chicken.  I bit into it and spit it out. It was rubbery terrible chicken. Ive been sick from eating chicken like that before so i didnt dare eat it. Then my garlic bread was black. Really? Even my garlic bread had to be bad. The pasta itself was ok but when i have to pay for things that never came or food that i didnt eat you tend to get pissed. Not going back.

Althought, this is not really a place I would choose to eat.  It's ok.  It's one of those "Damn, (name of place) is busy.  I guess let's do Chilli's since they have no line."  LOL Nothing there is my favorite.  But the only that I'll really get if I am there is the tripple dipper.  You can choose a bunch of stuffs to make up your "triple" dipper.  I always end up choosing buffalo wings times two and spinich dip.  Again, it's A-OK.  services is so-so.  (I'll be nice this time around because the last time I went there we ended up getting our food after waiting almost 45 minutes.  the food was cold already and i questioned it and the waiter told me that they were short staff.  HELLO there was NOBODY in there.  Darn you slackers...it was not even close to lunch time!)...oh well, i'm over it.

Late review but, the service was fast and friendly. Estimated waiting time to get our food for a party of 6 at lunch time (for us) was about 15 mins and drinks and appetizers came out in 5-10 :) Can't complain after a 3 hour study session for human anatomy :)

Ok - this is my second time at Chili's at Waikele - Just went there after spending a disappointing experience with the H&R Block so called tax specialist --- thumbs down. Our waitress is great - I think her name was Whitney -  Ok - we ordered their margarita's - my husband ordered the Coronita's margarita  - it has a lot of  WOW! effect - but nothing to brag about; and my daughter and I took the Tropical Sunrise Margarita - its okay. Then we ordered the their Tripler Dipper - with the potato skins, small burgers and boneless chicken wings : Potato skins - delicious - nothing to brag about - i've  tasted better, crisper potatoes Two small burgers - the meat look and tasted like it was left over from this morning batch or yesterdays - i made a comment about it - no one ate it. Boneless buffalo chicken - too salty. that's all you can taste -- salt. The sauce is awful -- i had to drowned it with my drink !!! The guy who gave us our food is not a server that's for sure. He placed the small plates to my daughter and husband's side and then he handed the plate by reaching around my husband's chair to hand me the plate!!! I can bet you this place will not last . They will be gone by 2016 ---- 1) Food is awful - they don't care about their customer's. 2) Our waitress is good - the other server (maybe a manager helping out?/) is awful  Too Bad!!!

We came for lunch around 11, and beat the crowd! We had awesome service! They refilled our waters, brought extra dressing and checked on us regularly! We ordered the chicken wings, which were really good. The kids pizza was really good as well. They have great French fries. The cheeseburger and avocado bacon Chicken sandwich were good. The chicken sandwich could have used more sauce.

It's been a while since we've come here. So we start off with the cheese fries and regular order of chicken nachos. They were delicious. For our meals we had the Carribean Salad with grilled shrimp and the Cobb Sald. Both were generous in portion and tasty. Our server was Brooke and she was awesome. Refilling our drinks and attentive to us. Service has improved from before and we left very satisfied!

My family and i always come here. Like we don't even have to look at the menu bcz we always get the same order, specially my kids, they love it there. Very convenient bcz we live managers side and waikele is really close to us. So when we don't cook , we always think of chilis. Not only the foods, but the waitress are very friendly.  Anyways we got a GC and i decided to use it today and make a phone call for to go. It is my first time ordering over the phone, bcz like i said we live coming here.  So the person i was talking to name LISA , i could not hear her much so i kept saying "what was that again?" And i also asked some info about my order. I heard her in the background saying "urgh OMG". I wanted to complain at the place, it upset me so bad that i think i will be going to pearl city one instead. I worked costumer service for nine years, i also worked as a receptionist. And to me? As much as possible if the costumer cant hear me, i will try to speak louder  and make sure to answer any questions. But with her? It seems like she doesn't even wanna take order over the phone. I asked her name and at first she did not answer,  she just repeated my order.  But i asked again, then she finally say LISA.

This place is good just as long you know what you're ordering. Go during happy hour for discounted magaritas and appetizers. Just wished their happy hour could be over @ 7:30pm instead of 6pm.  Artichoke dip, Texas fries, egg rolls, chicken crispers are safe choices there. Besides that, I don't really care for their main courses.

I love to read reviews on yelp & never ever wrote one of my own...until now ! So disappointed ! A few days ago their pos system went down where they were unable to take payments. I totally understand that happens sometimes and cannot help it, its not their fault. I was upset about the customer service ! I called in my takeout order about 11:30 & got there at 11:40. I seen a bag of food sitting behind the bar when i got th ere & i figured ot mustve been mine. Then i presented the gift certificate i had & waited for them to "fix" their payment system. I was cool with that. Over an hour later though... the waitress comes back to me with change $15 cash (mind you my order was only $30 & i gave her a $50 gift certificate) so i dont know what happened to the other five dollars ? Whatever. The part that really made me mad is she grabbed that bag of cold soggy food that was sitting behind the bar since i got there ! Really?! I had to ask her if i could get it made fresh.. hello common sense ! I wasnt expecting a discount or anything but when she charged me full cost for the damn food & handed my order to me like that i was pissed. You know what, i aint ever going to this location again. Horrible customer service !

The food is always awesome and if you think its not just ask and they will make it right.  A special thank you for the excellent service goes out to Alaina and Bronson.  If you want great service with great personalities don't hesitate to request their section when being seated!!!  Try their sweet potato fries.....delicious!!!!!!

Waikele's Chili's.. Didn't even eat here today. Valentines Day Walk inside first thing is sewage smell. Next three greeters take your name and ask you to wait. Its 11:15 hardly any patrons. But we're waiting 10 minutes. Three greeters still standing around and tables are empty. I ask why we cant be seated. "There are no servers here yet. Unsat. Walked out. Not returning either.
