We came here for lunch on a weekend and expected it to be crowded - especially on a Saturday at 12noon.  Okay - that should have been the first sign.  We were seated pretty quickly, but it took our server FOREVER to come and take our order.  The food is okay - my husband likes the steak fajitas - but thought they came with other bell peppers than just the green ones?  It's been a while since we've eaten here and it will be a long while until we come back.

First time at this location and second time overall.  Our server was Nicki and she was fantastic!  She gave good recommendations, she was patient, and she was checking up on us regularly.  The food here is pretty good.  I'm playing beached whale on my bed right about now.  We got the appetizers in which you can choose 3 from a list, and I had the sirloin light 6 oz steak.  The seasoning on the steak was a good amount and didn't need more from A1.  Nicki was very prompt and polite.  The food felt filling but not overly oily like some other places.  I think we may be coming to chilis more often.  The menu had some good options and the drinks were good as well.  What I like the most is how the device was good regardless of how busy it became.  As patrons we do understand (most of us) of the busy hours and how we may starve a little before our food comes out, so it makes a difference for the waitress to still drop by and fill up our waters.

First time ever at a Chili's and for sure will never eat at this one again - and while I might try one somewhere else (mainland) at some point, there's no burning desire to do that, except to test my theory that franchise restaurants in Hawaii are generally pretty horrible and nothing like they are supposed to be. (I ate at the Red Lobster in Waikiki once and everything about it was horrible and nothing like any of the Red Lobsters I've been to on the mainland.) What really ticks me about this Chili's is that my credit card was charged $2 more than the total I put down. I did call the store and they said it was a mistake. I don't see how it could be a mistake, but guess maybe give them the benefit of doubt....? They said they'll send it to home office in California and the $2 will be credited back... we'll see. My advice - if you use a credit card, make sure to check that what gets billed is correct (there's another Yelp review below with a $10 overcharge - and how many people will bother to check and then write about it????) The food was a huge disappointment: didn't know what to order as first time here - but I did the Chicken bacon ranch quesadilla. It was dry. Horrible. Partner did spicy grilled shrimp taco - it was better, but not enough sauce, rice not good, and the main ingredient - the shrimp - not good quality. Service was not great - while server checked back almost immediately after food was delivered, we wanted drinks and never could get attention of server until it was time to pay the bill.  We won't be back.

The prices are way too high here even for island prices for the crap they serve claiming to be food.  The prices on the margaritas are so bad I cough even when we go in for happy hour.  I mean $13 for a Patron Margarita in a small glass that is mostly ice, when you can go buy a bottle at Long's for $30.   Service sucks, it's like all they can convince to work there are dowdy women with zero personality.  It takes forever to get a waitress to your table to start with and the pattern continues throughout the meal.  Won't bother going back!!

Amazing staff and management, however I am very allergic to avocados and ordered my sandwich without them (even double checked)...I then discovered when my lunch arrived that they had put the avocados on and then scraped them off.  As mentioned, the server and manager were extremely helpful and offered me soup and replaced the sandwich promplty.

148/365 Came here for a late lunch because my friend had a gift card.  By the time we went, around 230 or so, there was still a good amount of people there enjoying and/or waiting for their food and coming in.  Our server was a bit slow to help us throughout our meal too.  As for food, me and my friend shared the new margarita tacos and the triple dipper app in which we chose the spinach and artichoke dip with chips, their buffalo wings, and boneless chicken wings.  Food came out pretty slow considering what we ordered.  The tacos were good but lacked some kind of sauce/salsa.  It only had a spread of beans to give it "moisture." On top of that was the chicken, topped with cheese, tortilla strips and some tomato mix.  It also came accompanied with a little dish of black beans and some "mexican" rice.  The triple dipper was okay, the the boneless chicken wings did not look like the picture and came with a honey mustard sauce and according to my friend it wasnt as crispy as before.  The buffalo wings were okay too, nothing special, and the tiny dish of the dip was pretty good but came topped with a lot of Parmesan cheese.  As for dessert we got their new red velvet molten cake with the molten part being a cream cheese center and topped with vanilla ice cream and a chocolate shell.  It was good and delicious, the outer cake part was a bit dry but of course, towards the middle it was very good and moist.  Overall, food is pricey for what you get but just like service, it is just okay.
Great place to eat lunch. Baby back ribs are our favorite. Servers are nice and efficient.

I really wish there was an option for ZERO STARS! Got seated at an awkward spot in between two incredibly noisy tables, got our sodas. We politely asked if we could be moved to a booth, which we were, and then... nothing. Sat around waiting for a server for half an hour, several employees walked past without even glancing over at us. We each took a couple sips of our sodas and decided to leave. Left money for the sodas we barely drank and walked out. On the way out, we were asked if we had gotten our orders in by one of the servers who were just standing at the front. WTH??? No, we were basically seated and forgotten. This is a perfectly ridiculous ending to my craptacular week with awful customer service...
Average food, ok prices, sub-par service. I just like the location but it can get pretty busy.

My friend and I came here after work for dinner. Parking wasn't too bad with it being somewhat early, around 5ish. We were seated right away and our waitress was very nice. My friend and I debated whether to get our usual or try something different. My plan was to order the same thing I always do, but the more I looked at the menu the more I had difficulty choosing. Of course in the end I ended up with the same thing I always order, the bar burgers with a side of honey mustard. It was delicious so I decided to order dessert. I ordered the chocolate chip paradise pie. It was okay, somewhat too sweet and I remembered that I'm not a fan of coconut. My friend ordered the honey chipotle chicken crispers with the sauce on the side. Yes, they even put the sauce on the side for her. I really enjoyed the corn on the cob.  Overall our experience was good. Chili's is a good place to hang out with friends and enjoy some good food.

My husband and I went to this location near the Waipahu Outlets, on a Friday afternoon around lunch and had the worst experience at a Chili's. We were quickly seated in an empty section and waited and waited...and waited for anyone to notice our presence. After about five minutes, another group was seated in our section and shortly after their arrival, a waitress swoops in and gets our order. She brings us our sodas and that is the last we see of her until the bill comes. Our glasses were empty longer than they were full and we would had to ask other servers to help us with a refill. The restaurant did pick up shortly after we started eating and it seemed like our waitress got very flustered at the increasing line waiting out in the lobby but seriously, how long does it take to get a refill? We left the Chili's and headed across the street to McDonald's for a soda. Service sucked that bad. There was a Genki Sushi in the same plaza and I wish I had tried them out instead of going into this Chilis. The worst server in the history of serverdom. Ok, not really but she is definitely a contender in next year's Waitress Fails Olympics.

I am a very satistied customer. I have been craving their chips and salsa and chicken enchilada soup so i called this afternoon and ordered take out but i had my two lil ones in the car and one was sleeping.  So i spoke to the waiter and asked if they did the curb side p/u which i forgot they dont do (only outback does), and he said no but he can bring it out to the car for me.  When we arrived w/in a couple minutes he came out with my food well packed and he gave me a big bag of chips and salsa that was filled to the rim.  He was very polite and very helpfull. I will definately be returning. Excellent customer service and food!!! Thanks Chili's for fulfilling my cravings :)
This is your standard, run-of-the-mill Chilis.  Parking can be a little hard to find, if you don't mind walking too far, park by Lowe's and walk.

We went yesterday partner and I and were excited to try their ribs. We ordered the two kinds the moist and the dry and they were terrible! the moist and the dry were tough and dry as can be and didnt taste nice at all. Old meat? failed cooking style? bad chef day? The waitress sort of apologized and offered me another rack but both of our moist versions were just the same. Really really dried out. They had covered it in bbq sauce to attempt to moisten it it seems but it was revolting! The meat was dried and we really had to work hard to get it off the bone. False advertising here Im afraid. Tried to make our way through the rack hoping that the end of it only was tough but stopped half way, it was a big let down. We were charged our full $55.00 for the meal with no kind of discount or apology as we left. Ruby Tuesdays in Mililani is still the best Ive eaten! We wont be going back to Chilis anytime soon. Dont recommend it at all. Poor Tourists, there really should be a "Cocos" like in CA!

Ok, it's a typical Chili's. Nothing too extraordinary about this place, but it is about a 5 minute drive from Kunia so that's good. Great shopping in Waikele as well. It's funny but whenever I visit a Chili's, Applebee's, Outback or TGI Friday's the movie "Waiting..." comes to mind. Who knows what the cooks are doing to my food? Whatever. I eat it anyway, what I don't know won't hurt me.

had dinner with my friend last saturday here. I've been here many time, but last saturday our server was rude. we just seated on out table then she came asking for our order. As she can she we just started browsing the menu and she didnt even greeted us. For the whole time I didnt see her smile. Management need to orient their crew on good customer service.

Never had a bad experience with the food here (usually stick to the sake thing). The service tonight was really between 3-4 stars .serer meant well he was just so slammed ( LUCKY HE'S A HOTTIE OR HE'D GET 2 STARS).

my bf and I always go to Waikele Chili's (almost 5 years now) and we always get excellent customer service. Service: really good. never ever had a problem. the staff are always friendly, and some are really good with people and can crack a few good jokes. they always tell us about the specials and if there are any new items on the menu. i even stopped the manager to tell him how much i love this chilis! the food doesn't take long to come out either. maybe the longest i've waited was about 15-20min.  Price: not bad, for the two of us we pay about $50-60 depending on how many drinks I order (lol) but its not too pricey  Parking: there is ample parking Wait: i never wait too long. the longest i've waited was 10-15 min even when its really crowded. i love this chilis, a great place to hang out, have a few drinks, or have a casual date with your loved ones!

After a lovely morning of golf @ the Royal Kunia, we came up w/an extremely short list of places for drinks and food that eventually brought us here.  Ordered the Caribbean salad loaded w/chopped red bell pepper, dried cranberries green onion topped w/a grilled chicken breast.  Paired w/a glass of red wine, it was a perfect luncheon for a girl's day out.

Came here on a Sunday night after catching a flick.  We were seated right away after arriving.  Our server was there in a minute or two to take our drink orders which came out quickly.  I had the honey chipotle chicken crispers.  We didn't have to wait long for our meals to arrive. The meal was alright - the fries could have been a bit less salty and the chicken could've used more spicy heat.  But overall, I was satisfied with the meal and the service (our server made her rounds checking on us).  So an OK visit for us since we got was was expected of a dining visit.  Nothing extraordinary, but then again nothing to ruin the experience either.
0 stars! Worst service ever!! They didn't even give me the complete meal. All the people that sat around us got in after us, got their food way before us, and even left Chili's before us.

Of all the Chili's in Hawaii, Waikele Chili's has the best cooks.  The food is way better prepared at this Chili's than any of the Chilis on island.  The staff are very friendly and the manager came out and comped some of our food when we waited patiently for our food.  NOW that is service!!!  Our waiter last night didn't have to wait for us to ask her to refill our drinks.  When she saw that our drinks were half full, she came by and gave us another glass.  A week ago, I went there for happy hours and had the best rib eye steak that I've ever eaten at any of the chilis.  Not only was it juicy but it was melt in your mouth.  NOW THAT I didn't expect from chilis.  Overall I have had nothing but AMAZING service from this place!

Me and a few of my friends came here for dinner. Once we got there, we got sat quickly. I thought that quick seating = quick service. But oh no. It took a while for our server to come and take our drink orders. She was really friendly, like reeeallllyyyy friendly, and I suppose I should have been wary from the start. We ordered appetizers to start, which came quickly. But, it took a while for the server to come and take our food orders/refill drinks/refill the "unlimited chips". It is a good thing we love to catch up, or I would've bust out my watch and timed it. So, the food comes. Eh. Both of my friend's food tasted funny, but they decided not to "make ass" and managed to eat around it. I had a burger with maple bacon, some sort of tangy bbq sauce, and fried onions. The burger was cooked good, but the elements all together did not mesh. The maple bacon was too sweet to be eaten with the tangy sauce. For some reason, the lettuce was shredded, like the ones from Mickey D's. I mean, if I wanted mediocre lettuce, I would have went there. Our server took forever to check up on us. Don't get me wrong, she was apologetic, but I got the sense that she wasn't genuinely sorry. We just kept waiting. and waiting. and waiting. until finally she showed up to check up on us again, but this time my friends and I were smart. We asked for the check right away and boxes for the rest of the food that was deemed edible enough to take home. She took forever to bring the check, and took longer than that to pick it up and run all 3 cards.  WTH?! I mean, her section wasn't even busy! I swear I saw all the other servers including the host more times that our server! Ugh. Never going back there. Friendly service does not = great service. BOO!

Ate here on Sunday for dinner.  Ordered the sliders with the onion rings and fries.  Everything seemed ok, good food, good service. Then a couple hours later it wasn't.  Started developing a fever and nausea.  Then came the diarrhea and vomiting.  I got food poisoning I'm assuming from the burgers because my girlfriend ate all the same foods as me throughout the day and the only difference was our dinner. Never going back to Chili's again.

Awe man.  What the heck happened to the food?  It's been years since I have last eaten at Chilis and eating their oil ridden, tasteless food was not the reason I stopped coming.  It is true that I wasn't impressed with the food in my previous dining experiences but after this past visit I have decided that this would probably be one the the last choices of eateries we would go to for a meal.  I ordered the fajita trio and it was simply unappetizing.  I ate my husband's left over chicken quesadillas for lunch the following day and it left me with a feeling of disgust and was probably attributed to the excessive oil seeping from the tortilla.  My opu was not happy.
Great service. The shrimp was excellent but the salmon was a bit fishy. Price is fair but it is Hawaii. I would come back.

Always a smiling face when walking through the door helps ease a long day into a good meal experience.  Never have had a server that didn't treat us bad. Always serving everything hot and explains the menu items well

Compared to the mainland, most of the chains in Hawaii are overpriced.  Expect to pay $5-$7 for the same meal that you can get on the mainland.   That said, there are only a few wide variety food choice places in Kapolei, and this is one.   Is it my favorite?  No, Would I go back? Yes because its what we have out here in the sticks.

Just arrived in HI, and waiting for friends to come in on later flights.  My friend and I didn't feel like experimenting, so we used my navigation to find the closest Chili's.   We sat at the bar to order food to go.  The bartender was nice, but our food took FOREVER!!  Plus, prices in Hawaii are more than in Cali, so it was even worse.   To top if off, once the boys were picked up at the airport, we got constant "you guys went to CHILI's?!?!"  @$$holes.

Bleh. Everytime I get posed with the question of "Do you want to eat at Chili's or do you want to eat at ------?" my natural response is the latter. Tonight was one of those I-want-to-stay-in-the-area nights where I was too lazy to go somewhere else. We ended up at Chili's. Theres that same smell when you enter all Chili's. Anyways, we sit and I suggest a margarita to the husband. He chose the World's Freshest Margarita blended and I chose the Patron Pomegranate Margarita on the rocks. Those were super tasty! Anyways, we felt like burgers so the husband orders the normal Oldtimer burger and I order the Blazin' Big Mouth burger bites. We finally got our order and mmm! totally dug all the jalapenos in my burgers. The husband polished his off and needed to finish the rest of my plate. I totally liked our server as she was on it and pretty personable. Anyways, the only junk thing is that I felt like I ate a cow and my pocket was emptied. Our margaritas cost more then our meals! Anyways, a pretty good choice for convenience.

The food for the most part is way too salty and ultra processed for me but went here last night and ordered a "FULL rack" of baby back ribs. The overall flavor was pretty good but I was seriously disappointed that they try to disguise what is clearly 2/3 of a rack as a full rack. Times may be tough but this is false advertising! Felt ripped off and am now fully anti-Chili's.

I know lots of people that like this place, unfortunately i have never had a good experience here.  The worst was about a year ago, I went to the Chili's in the Waikele Shopping center.  Since we live nearby and my grandma was in town we thought we'd stop by and grab a bite.  It took twenty minutes just for a waitress to arrive and she seemed very irritable and overworked, we waited over a half an hour for luke warm food, and as we were waiting for the bill a roach ran across our table!!   Perhaps it's improved since then but I for one will never go back there.

Amazing service. The bartenders make spectacular drinks.  The service is amazing, they honestly have the customers best interest in mind rather then raising their tips.  After getting to know the employees I can trust that they do not spit in your food and keep all hairs on their.  I really love their tripledippers with all my heart and soul.  I would recommend it to all locals!

The first Chili's I've ever been to and still the best. Excellent location, service, and food. It's busy to the point of being fun. There is often a wait during meal times. I've been to other Chili's around Hawaii and California, but the Waikele Chili's is still the best!

Service on my visit was great.  Based on prior reviews, it sounds like I lucked out - I'm sure it helped that the restaurant was only about 3/4 full at the time we arrived.  The food was good and arrived really quickly after we ordered.  Service was polite and attentive without being overly so.  Would I go back?  If I'm in the area, yes.
This will be short.  I only went because I had a gift card.  I really don't care for this place but they actually surprised me with the turkey club on wheat texas toast.  other than that...BLICK!!

I don't know why I keep torturing myself by going to Chili's.  The first thing that hits you is the ridiculous wait.  The second is the lacquer on the wooden part of the tables being so sticky it feels dirty.  The third is the actual dirt and grime on the table lamps (who wants to see that as they eat?).  And the fourth thing is their crappy food that makes you go number two as soon as you get home. Add a star because I like meeting my buds at the bar and getting bottomless tostada chips with a Presidente Margarita.  Other than that, I'll pass...
Felicia was a good waitress. Kept our drinks full, checked back on us often, and even brought out extra sauces, ranch, salsa, etc before even having to ask. Food was great!

Good service, food is good - it's a Chili's so you know what to expect. Drink prices are decent. I've come here more than a few times for both lunch and dinner. The only ever so slightly annoying thing is sometimes the server takes a minute to make initial contact after being sat. Otherwise, I've had nothing but great experiences. Their new enchiladas are tasty. Chips and queso are my app of choice. Quesadilla explosion salad and buffalo chicken salad are great and very filling. Chicken Fajitas are always good. I'll be back.

Let me just make this clear (again - I believe I mentioned this in another Chili's post): I am not a huge Chili's fan. Ever since moving to Hawaii it seems to the popular spot to meet up with people though. And that is the reason I found myself at this Chili's.  A Chili's is a Chili's. Though I will admit I do like it better out here compared to when I was in Colorado.  Food was good. The atmosphere good. Our waitress was FANTASTIC. I thought she was so kind and so attentive - she really made our lunch date that much better - so thank you!  I got the club sandwich for lunch. I love the fries (I love fries in general). I liked the Club sandwich too, it was quite tasty. The only downside I thought the sandwich was just a bit too bit - hard to bite into and because it was such a large bite I usually ended up making a mess because the sandwich would slide apart. I admit I can be known for creating a decent mess while eating, but this mess was unnecessary and I like to think not my fault. Okay - I'm just complaining about things that don't really matter - the food was good, service good, atmosphere good.

Came here for lunch with my son and friend. The chipotle flatbread lunch special was amazing!! Great price and good amount of food. I also have the ID card and here I got $5 off my purchase of $25+. Food the flatbread is Awesome if you can handle the spicyness of the chipotle sauce! My son ended up eating all my baked potato soup, which is one of my favorites! Our waitress was Catherine k. She was very kind but could have been more attentive. It seemed when we needed things we had to wait a while for her to eventually pop up. Other than that, well be back :)

Food has gone down - our favorite Texas Fries is always served on a black plate that burns the fries - horrible taste and black stuff peels off with the food - YUCK! Some servers very attentive, others -- well are not.

We had a large amount of people 16 to be exact and the waitress was so slow. It seems like when tip is guaranteed the waitress just does the basics. Drinks were slowly refilled. We were left there for long periods of time without asking if we needed anything. We spent 2 and a half hours there.

Was not bad. Wife and I ordered their Triple dipper. I had the Philly cheesesteak, blackened chicken sandwich, and Loaded potato skins for my platter. Everything was tasty. Wife ordered Egg rolls, Buffalo Bites, and the Artichoke spinach dip. Very tasty. My daughter had the bottomless Salad and Enchilada soup. Soup was really good. And don't forget the Bottomless Chips and Salsa. I think this was the first time I had ever finished my meal there.

Located in Waikele Shopping Center next to McDonalds and near Genki Sushi... across from Lowe's and Sports Authority with LOTS of parking. Been here a couple times and each time the experience wasn't astounding... Visited yesterday for lunch with my BFF's... we arrived at 1230... can't remember our servers name but she was definitely on it! Very friendly, sociable, and "on it" with refilling our drinks and checking on us. We got the triple dipper to start with: eggrolls, chicken crispers, and boneless buffalo wings. It came out in about 15 minutes and was hot and fresh. YUM. My friend ordered a classic burger well done, other friend chicken tacos, and I got a mushroom swiss burger medium. Classic burger was huge and cooked and done to her liking. Chicken tacos were SMALL and SUPER SAD looking. No sauce and very small pieces of chicken... it was just dry and she said it had no flavor and was nor worth $14. My burger was supposed to be medium but came out WELL DONE (eek!) but I was hungry so I didn't send it back... also I HATE onions and had read on the menu that it doesn't come with onions, but just to be on the safe side I asked the server and she confirmed it didn't come with onions... but of course it came out to me with onions. YUCK! I seriously woulda sent it back but I was SO hungry and my friend with the sad looking tacos wanted the onions lol.  Dessert: molten chocolate cake and red velvet style molten cake. I didn't care for the red velvet cake but they loved it. The molten chocolate cake was BOMB!  I still don't like this location and based on my last 3 visits I definitely won't be returing. Mililani and Pearlridge have waaaaay better service and the quality of the food is waaaaaaay better! (not that our server today sucked because she was good!... but the last 2 times our server wasn't great!)

Need to work on service. A table of four has 4 servers attending them. A table of 10 ONLY 1 server. Had to go to kitchen 3 times to ask for things. We left $1 for the only girl to attend to us. Some guy we never saw returns the $1 when we are in the parking lot and says, "we never worked for this."  I'm thinking, yes d$$$@55 , you didn't work for it. It was for the girl."
The service is awful. The mixed drink menu, is awful.  They don't carry any of the fruits for drink. Waitress doesn't know what the bar carries.

Okay food. If you order the triple dipper, do not get the boneless buffalo chicken. Get the bone-in wings. It's the tail end of Fall semester. Expect to see more college students to be around either working in the staff or hanging out at the bar watching the game. It's a good dining experience when hanging out with friends which helps my reviews on "okay" food.

We came here for lunch today and all I can say is the food made us all sick to our stomachs literally.  I think it was the artichoke dip that we ordered as an appetizer but didn't get until after our meal came. The vomiting and  diarrhea have not stopped since an hour after we ate!  We will NEVER eat at this restaurant ever again!!!  I urge everyone not to eat here unless you enjoy getting sick.  The next call I will be making is to the health department tomorrow morning.  If I could give minus stars for this restaurant I would.

*Update:  Just ate at Chili's tonight and had Carl K. as our server.  Best server ever.  Good timing, friendly, thoughtful.  As we finished up our meal he brought a strawberry lemonade in a take-out cup instead of a glass.  Keep up the good work! Whoa, I don't know whats with all the hatin on this Chili's location but I'm definitely a fan.  Located in busy busy Waikele parking can be kinda confusing but I promise you will find a spot even if its way down by Old Navy. I will outline my genuine liking of this restaurant in comparison to restaurants like it.  First Chili's has quite a few solid options that makes it a keeper.   The chicken crispers are by and far my favorite meal at chili's.   The medium bodied batter around tender chicken strips and fantastic honey mustard sauce makes it my kinda gal.  Can I get it with white rice? Yes.  Does it come with a corn on the cob to feign a shred of healthfulness?  Yes.  What does Outback have compared this this?  Alice Springs Chicken? Meh. Too much cheese and too oily (and more expensive).  Zippy's?  Nope.  Big City? Negative. The next "money" choice is the sampler platter.  First off you choose what you want on it from a list of appetizers.  Southwest eggrolls?  Superb.  Chicken crispers?  Whoa these again? YES PLEASE. Boneless wings, regular wings, you name it.  Order this sucker with a side of rice and BAM dinner with variety. One of their long running promotions is the $20 dinner for two.  Such a good deal.  You split an appetizer (the texas cheese fries are money in the bank) and each get an entree from a special list.  But the real question is, is the chicken crispers entree on this list?  YOU BET IT IS. I'm tired of mediocre honey mustard, thank you Chili's. The burgers are actually really really good.  The bun is something to be desired and the burger is more or less cooked to your liking.  The star of the burger though is the bacon.  Whoever makes their bacon is a genius.  None of your Bar-S store bought junk is a pack.  This is thick cut, savory, smoky bacon. Good job Chili's, sorry people hate on you.

Why, oh why don't I learn to stuff myself before I go shopping with my family in Waikele?  Or just head on down to a local Japanese restaurant in Waipahu before the blood sugar heads south, and I lose all rationality about what should be consumed?!  Not long ago, we stumbled in here after shopping too long, and we were famished!  Normally, when the family is starving, we will eat anything in sight and think it's great.  However, this was not the case at Chili's Waikele. Wherefore, thou asketh, doth thou thumb thy nose at this bastion of culinary delight?  I will enumerate as follows: One: The scullery maid had such an angry countenance and demeanor, it would surely frighten such a one as Vlad the Impaler; Two:  The victuals were cooked to such a degree, leaving no moisture therein, wherefore there was great danger that they would lodge permanently in the esophagus, had I not a big stoup of root beer at the ready; Three: The music, if it could be called such, which emanated from speakers in the dining hall, was played with such amplification as to risk rupturing the tympanic membranes of our delicate ears. Thus have I with much veracity spoken, and by my troth, will endeavor to never set my arse in this establishment again!

While we all know that Chili's is the quintessential chain restaurant that has the potential to gross us out with their C grade food and oily spinach artichoke dip, in a pinch Chili's seriously can hit the spot! Therefore I'm reviewing based on the awesome service we had when we walked in 30 minutes before closing time.  We were seated and served by a really enthusiastic waitress who I suspect might be the manager and hence the stellar service. If she's faking her happiness and is in fact putting her game face on throughout the entire night then she seriously deserves that position. Either that or she could really love working for the company that's notorious for the catchy "I want my baby back baby back baby back baby back..."  Ordered a sampler appetizer with buffalo wings, spinach and artichoke dip and the southwestern eggrolls.  Yeah, it's horrible for your arteries. Let's not even critique the food. It is what it is: a heart attack waiting to happen in 20 years. Although I must say the blackberry iced tea was delicious.  I wish I got the name of our server but she really made the dining experience enjoyable and the food taste that much better. Also, on Friday and Saturdays they're open until 11 which is more than most restaurants on the island can say! I'll go here again if I get a craving for some margaritas and greasy, gooey cheese dip.
Just about the worst meal ever. Bad service and terrible food. I could have had a better meal at McDonalds

Unfortunately, this review is a bit skewed because I'm on a special diet and cannot partake in all the great stuff that makes burger restaurants so bad for us (see mainly french fries on this trip). Although what was good is that they were able to adjust our order, so we could stay within our diet plan and eat one of their burgers (Atkins style). You see, when I usually go to a Chili's it's mainly about the Mushroom Swiss Burger (not sure of the exact name), but it's money. Our waitress looked really young (compliment) and handled everything well since we had all this modifications and such. Although at the end, with my sad look on my face from having the french fries gone uneaten, she said, "Oh, we could have got you vegetables instead!"  "That's okay." I said, thinking that the vegetables would probably be tossed in butter, thus nullifying their nutritional value to our health and current diet. Parking was a little crowded because it shares the spot with Genki Sushi ( ) and McDonald's ( ).

Lunch time visit and the wait was no time at all. Made accommodations to seat my party of 5 and after my daughter decided to dump her drink on the floor, our server was super friendly and helpful. Food was prepared quickly and was very tasty. A little high priced so that would be my only deterrent in returning.

First review of the new year.  Sorry it is late.  I actually ate here on New Year's day.  Happily it was one of the only dine in places that was open in my area.  Any ways...  Chili's really does not need a review...  American food when you need it. I will give a short review of what I ate. I have been dying to eat Mexican food so I ordered enchiladas and chicken quesadillas.  Surprisinly...I was shocked how much food it was and the taste.  All of it was very flavorable even the side dishes that were the black beans and rice.  It was so good that I somehow ate it all.  What I am sad about Chili's Hawaii is that they are not having the all you can eat enchillada meal that the States are advertising.

I ordered an trio appetizer & a full rack of ribs. My cousin & niece from Korea and I devoured the meal since we were famished from all the shopping. Service was great, speed was great and the price was great. However, we were glued to the toilet the rest of our day. It was our first meal/only meal of the day so I don't know how to not give Chili's all the credit... But I'll return next time... Cuz I love ribs and their chocolate molten cake....

The only time I have ever gone to chillies and gotten over the top spectacular service. Our waiter is so amazing and energetic he is by far given the best customer service i have ever recieved. It really takes alot to make me amazed and he has gone above and beyond we never had to wait or want for anything. I really wish we could have more waiters like Jordan. All I can say is wow hands down the best when I come back because I will I pray I get him. Really I am so happy I've been in customer service for 15 years and he is a star thanks for the amazing service.

Overpriced. Oh Chili's, why do you always make me spend so much money? After taking a break from shopping at the Waikele Outlets, Caitlyn G. and I decided to grab a quick bite at the conveniently located Chili's. We figured its mid-day, there should be a happy hour with some great deals. Well there is, but only M-F (3-6) - today was Saturday.  So, we arrive and were seated right away. Great. We were pleasantly greeted by our server Tim. He was a great server and I was very impressed. We looked over the drinks menu and I ordered the Grapefruit Margarita (sounds amazing right?) and Caitlyn ordered the Blueberry Pineapple Margarita. It really bothers me that there is no prices on their drink menu. Why do they not put prices on there? Oh yes, because the drinks are completely over priced. We payed ~$12-13 for our margs and they were about 16oz. Ugh. We checked in on Yelp and got the free chips and queso/salsa. SCORE. The menu has a lot more choices and a variety of choices than the last time I visited. It is completely overwhelming but I am extremely pleased they offer more vegetarian items. They have a blackbean burger that you can substitute on any of their burgers.  I ordered the Quesadilla Explosion Salad. I have always loved this salad but hate ordering it and paying $13 when I don't get the chicken. Tim was so nice when I told him I didn't want the meat and he asked if I wanted avocado instead. YES! I was so happy, this was the first time that I actually had someone ask (at Chilis) if I wanted something substituted because I don't eat meat. A+ Tim!  We also ordered fried pickles and the sampler with fried cheese, buffalo wings (for Caitlyn) and spring rolls. The buffalo wings were below average. The friend pickles were great.  We ended our meal by splitting the check on their Zoisk. This thing is great! No more waiting for your bill! Just pay it on the Zoisk! Want to play games, pay $1.99 to play on the Zoisk. Want to order drinks - do it on the Zoisk.

This location made up for the bad experience we had at the Kahala Mall location. Even though they were busy the waitress didn't miss a beat. The host did what the other location failed to do and went outside to see of the party they were calling were outside. The waitress gave her feedback when we had questions and made sure everything was to out liking. Really good service.

I don't come here often but when I do, SAMPLER it is!! My usuals are the sliders, egg rolls, and honey boneless chicken. And now, they have fried cheese bites! Too bad the sampler only allows 3 choices. Service may not be consistent, but I did receive excellent service the last time I came here which was sometime this month. Food are at reasonable prices, however, prices for alcoholic beverages can be a little steep. Better to come here during happy hour. I do like their addition of those touch screens on the tables. It would be cooler if you could order your entire meal on it, but as of right now, you can only order dessert and RE-order drinks.
Not too bad at all. Your typical chillis here. Had a huge selection of tv's to choose from with a few options of sports. Waiter was attentive and did a great job. A must visit if you're in the area

Had a great time last night. We were seated right away and there were nine of us!! Our waitress Angelica was awesome. She took great care of us and was super friendly.  The food was very tasty and the molten lava cake was delicious. Thank you Angelica for a great experience.

Wonderful customer service from Angelica last night!! We called ahead when leaving our house, but couldn't leave our name for a table due to them having a lot of parties last night. We got there and got seated within 5 minutes. Angelica was our waitress, she took our drink orders immediately. She was very friendly, explained the menu to us and also offered chips and salsa. I checked into Yelp and received a free queso and chips also, which was yummy! Our food came in a timely manner, our refills came without us even asking for them, excellent service! We love the food at chilis and definitely will be back again! Thank you Angelica for such amazing service...
Went twice in a week as food and service is really good.  Big portions and the chilli is one of the best.
Good Service Decent food! Come to this Chilis quite a lot good food and the service is nice. Would definitely go again.
Awesome customer service by Jenny and lol Ryan.. We had a wonderful experience here at Waikele Chili's this evening.. We will definitely be back!  Thank you Yelp for the free Queso and chips..

On our shopping trip to waikele, we decided to stop by chili's for lunch. Our waitress Mexi was awesome. She took care of us with her outstanding customer service. She always checked in with us and kept us updated on the status of our order and made sure our drinks were full.  Thank you Mexi for the good food and great service.
We love Waikele Chili's.  It's my daughters first choice  of places to eat at.  Our waitress is super friendly and food is great and service is fast.

We came to Chilli's after church Easter Sunday, just as they opened. The hostess greeted us with a smile and seated us immediately. There were TV's in every direction showing football, which kept the guys occupied. Our server, Tim, was awesome. He immediately took our drink order while we browsed the menu and scrolled through the electronic "ziosk."  "Checking in" on yelp gave us a free chips, queso and salsa appetizer, which was just delicious. For my meal, I ordered my usual- the triple sampler appetizer with my selection of sliders, southwest egg rolls, and instead of the loaded potato wedges, I opted to try the cheese bites. -Queso Dip: rich creamy cheese with browned seasoned beef mixed in. secretly my favorite part of the meal -Salsa: diced tomatoes, onions, and cilantro had good flavor and was very mild, suitable for "non spicy" eaters. -Chips: fresh and plentiful, our server even offered a refill! -Sliders (2): perfect sized burger, patty cooked medium well with onions and bacon bits inside. Yum! -Southwest Egg Rolls (2 cut in half): shredded chicken, black beans, and corn mixture, wrapped and deep fried. This comes with an avocado ranch dipping sauce.  -Cheese Bites: little pieces of mozzarella, lightly breaded and deep fried. These were a little too salty for my liking but I ate them anyway, dipping them in the queso! The "ziosk" was so convenient and easy to use, showing pictures and descriptions of popular menu items as well as games to purchase and options for paying your tab. It offers to split checks and calculates tip when paying with a credit/debit card, cash customers pay their tab through the server.. so "old school" for this high tech world :) Although we had "ziosk" as a second server, Tim was always around and did check in with us periodically. Overall, we enjoyed our meal and fast, friendly service.

Nah better not, trying to watch my figure, better stick with the margaritas LoL Not really the atmosphere for go if you like to have good fun, be loud and get rowdy.... it feels uptight, just the kind you go sit and eat and leave  Nah nah nah I stay complaining but I still come visit you guys

Came here on Margarita Monday after seeing the Chili's flyer on Facebook, but surprise surprise they don't honor it because it doesn't apply to Hawaii!! There was nowhere on the flyer that stated that, but okay-- since we were already there, we decided to just eat and drink.  We ordered margaritas anyway, and because the prices weren't on the menu, the server gave us estimates (that were completely off by a lot lol).  The food I ordered was not hot, at all. I've heard they microwave their food which I'm starting to believe now because my food was barely Luke warm. The service was 4 stars, the guy was attentive, nice, professional, and always checking up on us. The food quality and not honoring a promotional thing they were holding was why I gave 2 stars. Oh and he gave us complementary chips and salsa.  I ended up taking the food home, and ate the leftovers the next day for lunch. I ended up getting a super bad stomach ache Overall, I probably won't come back.
Great happy hour and fantastic  service from "Mexi"!  Nice break from shopping all day...
